s0235.literal: Throughout all under Heaven, hearts united and wills aligned.
s0235.idiomatic: Throughout all under Heaven, hearts united and wills aligned.

s0236.literal: Implements and measures were unified, writing and characters the same.
s0236.idiomatic: Implements and measures were unified, writing and characters the same.

s0237.literal: Wherever sun and moon shine, wherever boats and carriages reach.
s0237.idiomatic: Wherever sun and moon shine, wherever boats and carriages reach.

s0238.literal: All complete their lives, none fail to achieve satisfaction.
s0238.idiomatic: All complete their lives, none fail to achieve satisfaction.

s0239.literal: Acting in accordance with the times, this is the Emperor.
s0239.idiomatic: Acting in accordance with the times, this is the Emperor.

s0240.literal: Correcting and regulating different customs, traversing waters and surveying lands.
s0240.idiomatic: Correcting and regulating different customs, traversing waters and surveying lands.

s0241.literal: Caring for the black-headed people, morning and evening without slackening.
s0241.idiomatic: Caring for the black-headed people, morning and evening without slackening.

s0242.literal: Eliminating doubt and establishing laws, all know what to avoid.
s0242.idiomatic: Eliminating doubt and establishing laws, all know what to avoid.

s0243.literal: Regional lords divide duties, all governance easy and orderly.
s0243.idiomatic: Regional lords divide duties, all governance easy and orderly.

s0244.literal: All actions necessarily appropriate, none not as planned.
s0244.idiomatic: All actions necessarily appropriate, none not as planned.

s0245.literal: The Emperor's brilliance surveys and observes the four directions.
s0245.idiomatic: The Emperor's brilliance surveys and observes the four directions.

s0246.literal: Noble and base, honored and lowly, do not exceed their proper order.
s0246.idiomatic: Noble and base, honored and lowly, do not exceed their proper order.

s0247.literal: None in Langye are negligent; all are devoted to integrity and goodness.
s0247.idiomatic: None in Langye are negligent; all are devoted to integrity and goodness.

s0248.literal: Small and great all exert themselves, none dare be idle or negligent.
s0248.idiomatic: Small and great all exert themselves, none dare be idle or negligent.

s0249.literal: Far and near, retired and hidden, all are exclusively devoted to solemnity and dignity.
s0249.idiomatic: Far and near, retired and hidden, all are exclusively devoted to solemnity and dignity.

s0250.literal: Upright, direct, sincere, and loyal; affairs have constancy.
s0250.idiomatic: Upright, direct, sincere, and loyal; affairs have constancy.

s0251.literal: The Emperor's virtue stabilizes the four poles.
s0251.idiomatic: The Emperor's virtue stabilizes the four poles.

s0252.literal: Punishing disorder and eliminating harm, promoting benefit and bringing fortune.
s0252.idiomatic: Punishing disorder and eliminating harm, promoting benefit and bringing fortune.

s0253.literal: Managing affairs according to the seasons, all products multiply.
s0253.idiomatic: Managing affairs according to the seasons, all products multiply.

s0254.literal: The black-headed people are peaceful and tranquil, not using weapons of war.
s0254.idiomatic: The black-headed people are peaceful and tranquil, not using weapons of war.

s0255.literal: The six relations mutually protect each other; in the end there are no bandits or thieves.
s0255.idiomatic: The six relations mutually protect each other; in the end there are no bandits or thieves.

s0256.literal: Joyfully accepting teachings, thoroughly knowing laws and regulations.
s0256.idiomatic: Joyfully accepting teachings, thoroughly knowing laws and regulations.

s0257.literal: Within the six directions is the Emperor's territory.
s0257.idiomatic: Within the six directions is the Emperor's territory.

s0258.literal: West crossing the flowing sands, south reaching Beixianghu.
s0258.idiomatic: West crossing the flowing sands, south reaching Beixianghu.

s0259.literal: East possessing the Eastern Sea, north passing the Great Xia.
s0259.idiomatic: East possessing the Eastern Sea, north passing the Great Xia.

s0260.literal: Wherever human traces reach, none are not subjects.
s0260.idiomatic: Wherever human traces reach, none are not subjects.

s0261.literal: His achievements surpass the Five Emperors, his beneficence extends even to oxen and horses.
s0261.idiomatic: His achievements surpass the Five Emperors, his beneficence extends even to oxen and horses.

s0262.literal: None do not receive his virtue; each is secure in their dwelling.
s0262.idiomatic: None do not receive his virtue; each is secure in their dwelling.

s0263.chinese: 維秦王兼有天下，立名為皇帝，乃撫東土，至于瑯邪。
s0263.literal: When the King of Qin unified all under Heaven, he established the title of Emperor, then pacified the eastern lands, reaching Langye.
s0263.idiomatic: When the King of Qin unified all under Heaven, he established the title of Emperor, then pacified the eastern lands, reaching Langye.

s0264.chinese: 列侯武城侯王離、列侯通武侯王賁、倫侯建成侯趙亥、倫侯昌武侯成、倫侯武信侯馮毋擇、丞相隗林、丞相王綰、卿李斯、卿王戊、五大夫趙嬰、五大夫楊樛從，與議於海上。
s0264.literal: Ranked marquis Lord Wucheng Wang Li, ranked marquis Lord Tongwu Wang Ben, marquis Lord Jiancheng Zhao Hai, marquis Lord Changwu Cheng, marquis Lord Wuxin Feng Wuze, Prime Minister Wei Lin, Prime Minister Wang Wan, Minister Li Si, Minister Wang Wu, Grand Master Zhao Ying, Grand Master Yang Jiu accompanied him and deliberated at the sea.
s0264.idiomatic: Ranked marquis Lord Wucheng Wang Li, ranked marquis Lord Tongwu Wang Ben, marquis Lord Jiancheng Zhao Hai, marquis Lord Changwu Cheng, marquis Lord Wuxin Feng Wuze, Prime Minister Wei Lin, Prime Minister Wang Wan, Minister Li Si, Minister Wang Wu, Grand Master Zhao Ying, Grand Master Yang Jiu accompanied him and deliberated at the sea.

s0265.chinese: 曰：「古之帝者，地不過千里，諸侯各守其封域，或朝或否，相侵暴亂，殘伐不止，猶刻金石，以自為紀。
s0265.literal: They said: "Ancient emperors had territories no more than a thousand li; feudal lords each guarded their territories, sometimes coming to court and sometimes not, mutually invading and creating violent disorder, attacking and killing without end, yet still carved in metal and stone to make their own records.
s0265.idiomatic: They said: "Ancient emperors had territories no more than a thousand li; feudal lords each guarded their territories, sometimes coming to court and sometimes not, mutually invading and creating violent disorder, attacking and killing without end, yet still carved in metal and stone to make their own records.

s0266.chinese: 古之五帝三王，知教不同，法度不明，假威鬼神，以欺遠方，實不稱名，故不久長。
s0266.literal: The ancient Five Emperors and Three Kings had different teachings, laws and regulations were unclear, falsely invoking the authority of ghosts and spirits to deceive distant regions; reality did not match reputation, so they did not last long.
s0266.idiomatic: The ancient Five Emperors and Three Kings had different teachings, laws and regulations were unclear, falsely invoking the authority of ghosts and spirits to deceive distant regions; reality did not match reputation, so they did not last long.

s0267.chinese: 其身未歿，諸侯倍叛，法令不行。
s0267.literal: Before their deaths, feudal lords already turned and rebelled, and laws and decrees did not function.
s0267.idiomatic: Before their deaths, feudal lords already turned and rebelled, and laws and decrees did not function.

s0268.chinese: 今皇帝并一海內，以為郡縣，天下和平。
s0268.literal: Now the Emperor has unified all within the seas as commanderies and counties; all under Heaven is harmonious and peaceful.
s0268.idiomatic: Now the Emperor has unified all within the seas as commanderies and counties; all under Heaven is harmonious and peaceful.

s0269.chinese: 昭明宗廟，體道行德，尊號大成。
s0269.literal: Brightly illuminating the ancestral temples, embodying the Way and practicing virtue, his honored title is greatly perfected.
s0269.idiomatic: Brightly illuminating the ancestral temples, embodying the Way and practicing virtue, his honored title is greatly perfected.

s0270.chinese: 群臣相與誦皇帝功德，刻于金石，以為表經。」
s0270.literal: The assembled ministers together recite the Emperor's achievements and virtue, carve them in metal and stone, to serve as a lasting standard."
s0270.idiomatic: The assembled ministers together recite the Emperor's achievements and virtue, carve them in metal and stone, to serve as a lasting standard."

s0272.chinese: 既已，齊人徐市等上書，言海中有三神山，名曰蓬萊、方丈、瀛洲，僊人居之。
s0272.literal: Having finished, Xu Shi of Qi and others submitted a memorial saying that in the sea there were three divine mountains named Penglai, Fangzhang, and Yingzhou, where immortals dwelt.
s0272.idiomatic: Having finished, Xu Shi of Qi and others submitted a memorial saying that in the sea there were three divine mountains named Penglai, Fangzhang, and Yingzhou, where immortals dwelt.

s0273.chinese: 請得齋戒，與童男女求之。
s0273.literal: They requested to fast and purify themselves and take boys and girls to seek them.
s0273.idiomatic: They requested to fast and purify themselves and take boys and girls to seek them.

s0274.chinese: 於是遣徐市發童男女數千人，入海求僊人。
s0274.literal: Thereupon he sent Xu Shi with several thousand boys and girls to enter the sea to seek the immortals.
s0274.idiomatic: Thereupon he sent Xu Shi with several thousand boys and girls to enter the sea to seek the immortals.

s0275.chinese: 始皇還，過彭城，齋戒禱祠，欲出周鼎泗水。
s0275.literal: The First Emperor returned, passed through Pengcheng, fasted and purified himself, prayed and made offerings, wishing to bring forth the Zhou tripod from the Si River.
s0275.idiomatic: The First Emperor returned, passed through Pengcheng, fasted and purified himself, prayed and made offerings, wishing to bring forth the Zhou tripod from the Si River.

s0276.literal: He sent a thousand people to dive underwater seeking it, but they did not find it.
s0276.idiomatic: He sent a thousand people to dive underwater seeking it, but they did not find it.

s0277.chinese: 乃西南渡淮水，之衡山、南郡。
s0277.literal: He then crossed the Huai River to the southwest, going to Mount Heng and Nan Commandery.
s0277.idiomatic: He then crossed the Huai River to the southwest, going to Mount Heng and Nan Commandery.

s0278.literal: Floating on the Yangtze, he reached the Xiang Mountain shrine.
s0278.idiomatic: Floating on the Yangtze, he reached the Xiang Mountain shrine.

s0279.literal: He encountered a great wind and nearly could not cross.
s0279.idiomatic: He encountered a great wind and nearly could not cross.

s0280.literal: The emperor asked the scholars: "Is the Spirit of the Xiang River divine?"
s0280.idiomatic: The emperor asked the scholars: "Is the Spirit of the Xiang River divine?"

s0281.chinese: 博士對曰：「聞之，堯女，舜之妻，而葬此。」
s0281.literal: The scholars replied: "We have heard she was Yao's daughter, Shun's wife, and was buried here."
s0281.idiomatic: The scholars replied: "We have heard she was Yao's daughter, Shun's wife, and was buried here."

s0282.chinese: 於是始皇大怒，使刑徒三千人皆伐湘山樹，赭其山。
s0282.literal: Thereupon the First Emperor became greatly angered, sent three thousand convicts to cut down all the trees on Mount Xiang, making the mountain bare and red.
s0282.idiomatic: Thereupon the First Emperor became greatly angered, sent three thousand convicts to cut down all the trees on Mount Xiang, making the mountain bare and red.

s0283.literal: The emperor returned from Nan Commandery through Wuguan.
s0283.idiomatic: The emperor returned from Nan Commandery through Wuguan.

s0284.literal: In the twenty-ninth year, the First Emperor traveled east.
s0284.idiomatic: In the twenty-ninth year, the First Emperor traveled east.

s0285.chinese: 至陽武博狼沙中，為盜所驚。
s0285.literal: At Yangwu in the Bolang sands, he was startled by bandits.
s0285.idiomatic: At Yangwu in the Bolang sands, he was startled by bandits.

s0286.chinese: 求弗得，乃令天下大索十日。
s0286.literal: They searched but did not find them, so he ordered a great manhunt throughout the land for ten days.
s0286.idiomatic: They searched but did not find them, so he ordered a great manhunt throughout the land for ten days.

s0287.literal: He ascended Mount Zhifu and had inscriptions carved on stone.
s0287.idiomatic: He ascended Mount Zhifu and had inscriptions carved on stone.

s0289.chinese: 維二十九年，時在中春，陽和方起。
s0289.literal: In the twenty-ninth year, in mid-spring, when yang harmony was arising.
s0289.idiomatic: In the twenty-ninth year, in mid-spring, when yang harmony was arising.

s0290.chinese: 皇帝東游，巡登之罘，臨照于海。
s0290.literal: The Emperor traveled east, toured and ascended Mount Zhifu, gazed upon the sea.
s0290.idiomatic: The Emperor traveled east, toured and ascended Mount Zhifu, gazed upon the sea.

s0291.chinese: 從臣嘉觀，原念休烈，追誦本始。
s0291.literal: His attending ministers admiringly observed, reflected on his splendid achievements, and recited his original beginnings.
s0291.idiomatic: His attending ministers admiringly observed, reflected on his splendid achievements, and recited his original beginnings.

s0292.chinese: 大聖作治，建定法度，顯箸綱紀。
s0292.literal: The Great Sage created governance, established fixed laws and regulations, and clearly displayed the fundamental principles.
s0292.idiomatic: The Great Sage created governance, established fixed laws and regulations, and clearly displayed the fundamental principles.

s0293.chinese: 外教諸侯，光施文惠，明以義理。
s0293.literal: Externally he taught the feudal lords, widely spreading civil beneficence, making clear righteousness and principles.
s0293.idiomatic: Externally he taught the feudal lords, widely spreading civil beneficence, making clear righteousness and principles.

s0294.chinese: 六國回辟，貪戾無厭，虐殺不已。
s0294.literal: The six states were devious and evil, greedy and cruel without limit, killing violently without end.
s0294.idiomatic: The six states were devious and evil, greedy and cruel without limit, killing violently without end.

s0295.chinese: 皇帝哀眾，遂發討師，奮揚武德。
s0295.literal: The Emperor pitied the masses, thereupon mobilized punitive armies, raising martial virtue.
s0295.idiomatic: The Emperor pitied the masses, thereupon mobilized punitive armies, raising martial virtue.

s0296.chinese: 義誅信行，威燀旁達，莫不賓服。
s0296.literal: Righteous punishment was trustworthy in execution, his awesome power reached all around, none were not submissive.
s0296.idiomatic: Righteous punishment was trustworthy in execution, his awesome power reached all around, none were not submissive.

s0297.chinese: 烹滅彊暴，振救黔首，周定四極。
s0297.literal: He boiled and destroyed the strong and violent, rescued and saved the black-headed people, and settled the four extremities.
s0297.idiomatic: He boiled and destroyed the strong and violent, rescued and saved the black-headed people, and settled the four extremities.

s0298.chinese: 普施明法，經緯天下，永為儀則。
s0298.literal: He universally applied clear laws, organized all under Heaven, forever to serve as a model.
s0298.idiomatic: He universally applied clear laws, organized all under Heaven, forever to serve as a model.

s0300.literal: Within the domains and counties, all obey the sage's will.
s0300.idiomatic: Within the domains and counties, all obey the sage's will.

s0301.chinese: 群臣誦功，請刻于石，表垂于常式。
s0301.literal: The assembled ministers recite his achievements and request to carve them on stone, to display them as a permanent standard.
s0301.idiomatic: The assembled ministers recite his achievements and request to carve them on stone, to display them as a permanent standard.

s0302.chinese: 其東觀曰：二十九年，皇帝春游，覽省遠方。
s0302.literal: The eastern inscription said: In the twenty-ninth year, the Emperor made a spring tour, surveying and inspecting distant regions.
s0302.idiomatic: The eastern inscription said: In the twenty-ninth year, the Emperor made a spring tour, surveying and inspecting distant regions.

s0303.chinese: 逮于海隅，遂登之罘，昭臨朝陽。
s0303.literal: Reaching the sea's edge, he then ascended Mount Zhifu, brightly facing the morning sun.
s0303.idiomatic: Reaching the sea's edge, he then ascended Mount Zhifu, brightly facing the morning sun.

s0304.chinese: 觀望廣麗，從臣咸念，原道至明。
s0304.literal: Observing the vast magnificence, all attending ministers reflected, wishing that the Way would become most brilliant.
s0304.idiomatic: Observing the vast magnificence, all attending ministers reflected, wishing that the Way would become most brilliant.

s0305.chinese: 聖法初興，清理疆內，外誅暴彊。
s0305.literal: The sage laws were first established, purifying and governing within the borders, externally punishing the violent and strong.
s0305.idiomatic: The sage laws were first established, purifying and governing within the borders, externally punishing the violent and strong.

s0306.chinese: 武威旁暢，振動四極，禽滅六王。
s0306.literal: Martial might spread all around, shook the four extremities, and captured and destroyed the six kings.
s0306.idiomatic: Martial might spread all around, shook the four extremities, and captured and destroyed the six kings.

s0307.chinese: 闡并天下，甾害絕息，永偃戎兵。
s0307.literal: He unified all under Heaven; disasters and harm were completely ended, forever putting down weapons of war.
s0307.idiomatic: He unified all under Heaven; disasters and harm were completely ended, forever putting down weapons of war.

s0308.chinese: 皇帝明德，經理宇內，視聽不怠。
s0308.literal: The Emperor's brilliant virtue governs and orders all within the universe; his seeing and hearing do not slacken.
s0308.idiomatic: The Emperor's brilliant virtue governs and orders all within the universe; his seeing and hearing do not slacken.

s0309.chinese: 作立大義，昭設備器，咸有章旗。
s0309.literal: He created and established great righteousness, clearly set up complete implements, all have banners and standards.
s0309.idiomatic: He created and established great righteousness, clearly set up complete implements, all have banners and standards.

s0310.chinese: 職臣遵分，各知所行，事無嫌疑。
s0310.literal: Official ministers follow their divisions, each knowing what to do; affairs have no suspicion or doubt.
s0310.idiomatic: Official ministers follow their divisions, each knowing what to do; affairs have no suspicion or doubt.

s0311.chinese: 黔首改化，遠邇同度，臨古絕尤。
s0311.literal: The black-headed people have been transformed; far and near share the same standards, approaching antiquity without parallel.
s0311.idiomatic: The black-headed people have been transformed; far and near share the same standards, approaching antiquity without parallel.

s0312.chinese: 常職既定，後嗣循業，長承聖治。
s0312.literal: Regular duties already established, later generations follow the enterprise, long upholding sage governance.
s0312.idiomatic: Regular duties already established, later generations follow the enterprise, long upholding sage governance.

s0313.chinese: 群臣嘉德，祗誦聖烈，請刻之罘。
s0313.literal: The assembled ministers praise his virtue, respectfully recite his sage achievements, and request to carve them at Zhifu.
s0313.idiomatic: The assembled ministers praise his virtue, respectfully recite his sage achievements, and request to carve them at Zhifu.

s0314.literal: Returning, he then went to Langye, entering by way of Shangdang.
s0314.idiomatic: Returning, he then went to Langye, entering by way of Shangdang.

s0315.literal: In the thirtieth year, there were no events.
s0315.idiomatic: In the thirtieth year, there were no events.

s0316.chinese: 三十一年十二月，更名臘曰「嘉平」。
s0316.literal: In the thirty-first year, twelfth month, the winter sacrifice was renamed 'Jiaping.'
s0316.idiomatic: In the thirty-first year, twelfth month, the winter sacrifice was renamed 'Jiaping.'

s0317.literal: He bestowed upon the black-headed people six shi of rice and two sheep per village.
s0317.idiomatic: He bestowed upon the black-headed people six shi of rice and two sheep per village.

s0318.chinese: 始皇為微行咸陽，與武士四人俱，夜出逢盜蘭池，見窘，武士擊殺盜，關中大索二十日。
s0318.literal: The First Emperor traveled incognito through Xianyang with four warriors; going out at night they encountered bandits at Lanchi and were in danger; the warriors struck and killed the bandits; a great manhunt was conducted in the Guanzhong region for twenty days.
s0318.idiomatic: The First Emperor traveled incognito through Xianyang with four warriors; going out at night they encountered bandits at Lanchi and were in danger; the warriors struck and killed the bandits; a great manhunt was conducted in the Guanzhong region for twenty days.

s0319.literal: Rice cost sixteen hundred per shi.
s0319.idiomatic: Rice cost sixteen hundred per shi.

s0320.chinese: 三十二年，始皇之碣石，使燕人盧生求羨門、高誓。
s0320.literal: In the thirty-second year, the First Emperor went to Jieshi and sent the Yan man Lu Sheng to seek Xianmen and Gao Shi.
s0320.idiomatic: In the thirty-second year, the First Emperor went to Jieshi and sent the Yan man Lu Sheng to seek Xianmen and Gao Shi.

s0321.literal: He had inscriptions carved on Jieshi Gate.
s0321.idiomatic: He had inscriptions carved on Jieshi Gate.

s0322.literal: He demolished city walls and opened dikes and dams.
s0322.idiomatic: He demolished city walls and opened dikes and dams.

s0324.chinese: 遂興師旅，誅戮無道，為逆滅息。
s0324.literal: Thereupon he raised armies and executed the lawless; rebellions were extinguished.
s0324.idiomatic: Thereupon he raised armies and executed the lawless; rebellions were extinguished.

s0325.chinese: 武殄暴逆，文復無罪，庶心咸服。
s0325.literal: Militarily he annihilated violent rebels; civilly he restored the innocent; the hearts of the masses all submitted.
s0325.idiomatic: Militarily he annihilated violent rebels; civilly he restored the innocent; the hearts of the masses all submitted.

s0326.chinese: 惠論功勞，賞及牛馬，恩肥土域。
s0326.literal: He benevolently evaluated achievements and service; rewards extended even to oxen and horses; his kindness enriched the land.
s0326.idiomatic: He benevolently evaluated achievements and service; rewards extended even to oxen and horses; his kindness enriched the land.

s0327.chinese: 皇帝奮威，德并諸侯，初一泰平。
s0327.literal: The Emperor exerted his might, unified the feudal lords' virtue, and first achieved great peace.
s0327.idiomatic: The Emperor exerted his might, unified the feudal lords' virtue, and first achieved great peace.

s0328.chinese: 墮壞城郭，決通川防，夷去險阻。
s0328.literal: He demolished city walls, opened river dams, and leveled dangerous obstacles.
s0328.idiomatic: He demolished city walls, opened river dams, and leveled dangerous obstacles.

s0329.chinese: 地勢既定，黎庶無繇，天下咸撫。
s0329.literal: The geographic situation having been established, the black-headed people had no corvée labor; all under Heaven was pacified.
s0329.idiomatic: The geographic situation having been established, the black-headed people had no corvée labor; all under Heaven was pacified.

s0330.chinese: 男樂其疇，女修其業，事各有序。
s0330.literal: Men delighted in their fields, women cultivated their work; affairs each had their order.
s0330.idiomatic: Men delighted in their fields, women cultivated their work; affairs each had their order.

s0331.chinese: 惠被諸產，久并來田，莫不安所。
s0331.literal: Beneficence spread to all products; long united they came to till fields; none were not secure in their places.
s0331.idiomatic: Beneficence spread to all products; long united they came to till fields; none were not secure in their places.

s0332.chinese: 群臣誦烈，請刻此石，垂著儀矩。
s0332.literal: The assembled ministers recite his achievements and request to carve this stone, to display the model and standard.
s0332.idiomatic: The assembled ministers recite his achievements and request to carve this stone, to display the model and standard.

s0333.chinese: 因使韓終、侯公、石生求僊人不死之藥。
s0333.literal: He then sent Han Zhong, Hou Gong, and Shi Sheng to seek immortals and the medicine of immortality.
s0333.idiomatic: He then sent Han Zhong, Hou Gong, and Shi Sheng to seek immortals and the medicine of immortality.

s0334.literal: The First Emperor toured the northern border and entered from Shangjun.
s0334.idiomatic: The First Emperor toured the northern border and entered from Shangjun.

s0335.chinese: 燕人盧生使入海還，以鬼神事，因奏錄圖書，曰「亡秦者胡也」。
s0335.literal: Lu Sheng of Yan, sent to enter the sea, returned with matters concerning ghosts and spirits; he then presented a book of charts saying 'Qin will be destroyed by Hu.'
s0335.idiomatic: Lu Sheng of Yan, sent to enter the sea, returned with matters concerning ghosts and spirits; he then presented a book of charts saying 'Qin will be destroyed by Hu.'

s0336.chinese: 始皇乃使將軍蒙恬發兵三十萬人北擊胡，略取河南地。
s0336.literal: The First Emperor thereupon sent General Meng Tian to mobilize three hundred thousand troops northward to attack the Hu, seizing the lands south of the Yellow River.
s0336.idiomatic: The First Emperor thereupon sent General Meng Tian to mobilize three hundred thousand troops northward to attack the Hu, seizing the lands south of the Yellow River.

s0337.chinese: 三十三年，發諸嘗逋亡人、贅婿、賈人略取陸梁地，為桂林、象郡、南海，以適遣戍。
s0337.literal: In the thirty-third year, he mobilized fugitives, superfluous sons-in-law, and merchants to seize the lands of Luliang, establishing Guilin, Xiang, and Nanhai commanderies, and sent convicts to garrison them.
s0337.idiomatic: In the thirty-third year, he mobilized fugitives, superfluous sons-in-law, and merchants to seize the lands of Luliang, establishing Guilin, Xiang, and Nanhai commanderies, and sent convicts to garrison them.

s0338.literal: To the northwest he drove out the Xiongnu.
s0338.idiomatic: To the northwest he drove out the Xiongnu.

s0339.chinese: 自榆中并河以東，屬之陰山，以為（三）［四］十四縣，城河上為塞。
s0339.literal: From Yuzhong along the Yellow River eastward, he connected it to the Yin Mountains, establishing thirty-four counties and building fortifications along the river as barriers.
s0339.idiomatic: From Yuzhong along the Yellow River eastward, he connected it to the Yin Mountains, establishing thirty-four counties and building fortifications along the river as barriers.

s0340.chinese: 又使蒙恬渡河取斑闕、（陶）［陽］山、北假中，筑亭障以逐戎人。
s0340.literal: He also sent Meng Tian to cross the Yellow River to take Banque, Yang Mountain, and Beijia, constructing watchtowers and barriers to drive out the Rong people.
s0340.idiomatic: He also sent Meng Tian to cross the Yellow River to take Banque, Yang Mountain, and Beijia, constructing watchtowers and barriers to drive out the Rong people.

s0341.literal: He exiled convicts to populate the new counties.
s0341.idiomatic: He exiled convicts to populate the new counties.

s0343.literal: A bright star appeared in the west.
s0343.idiomatic: A bright star appeared in the west.

s0344.chinese: 三十四年，適治獄吏不直者，筑長城及南越地。
s0344.literal: In the thirty-fourth year, he sent judicial officials who were not upright to build the Great Wall and in the lands of Southern Yue.
s0344.idiomatic: In the thirty-fourth year, he sent judicial officials who were not upright to build the Great Wall and in the lands of Southern Yue.

s0345.chinese: 始皇置酒咸陽宮，博士七十人前為壽。
s0345.literal: The First Emperor held a banquet at Xianyang Palace; seventy scholars came forward to offer congratulations.
s0345.idiomatic: The First Emperor held a banquet at Xianyang Palace; seventy scholars came forward to offer congratulations.

s0346.chinese: 仆射周青臣進頌曰：「他時秦地不過千里，賴陛下神靈明聖，平定海內，放逐蠻夷，日月所照，莫不賓服。
s0346.literal: Chief Clerk Zhou Qingchen came forward with a eulogy saying: "In former times Qin's territory was no more than a thousand li; relying on Your Majesty's divine spiritual brilliance and sagacity, you pacified all within the seas, expelled barbarians; wherever sun and moon shine, none are not submissive.
s0346.idiomatic: Chief Clerk Zhou Qingchen came forward with a eulogy saying: "In former times Qin's territory was no more than a thousand li; relying on Your Majesty's divine spiritual brilliance and sagacity, you pacified all within the seas, expelled barbarians; wherever sun and moon shine, none are not submissive.

s0347.chinese: 以諸侯為郡縣，人人自安樂，無戰爭之患，傳之萬世。
s0347.literal: Making the feudal states into commanderies and counties, people all feel secure and happy, without the troubles of warfare, to be transmitted for ten thousand generations.
s0347.idiomatic: Making the feudal states into commanderies and counties, people all feel secure and happy, without the troubles of warfare, to be transmitted for ten thousand generations.

s0348.literal: From high antiquity none match Your Majesty's awesome virtue."
s0348.idiomatic: From high antiquity none match Your Majesty's awesome virtue."

s0350.chinese: 博士齊人淳于越進曰：「臣聞殷周之王千餘歲，封子弟功臣，自為枝輔。
s0350.literal: Scholar Chunyu Yue of Qi came forward and said: "I have heard that the kings of Yin and Zhou reigned for over a thousand years, enfeoffing sons, younger brothers, and meritorious officials to serve as their branches and supports.
s0350.idiomatic: Scholar Chunyu Yue of Qi came forward and said: "I have heard that the kings of Yin and Zhou reigned for over a thousand years, enfeoffing sons, younger brothers, and meritorious officials to serve as their branches and supports.

s0351.chinese: 今陛下有海內，而子弟為匹夫，卒有田常、六卿之臣，無輔拂，何以相救哉？
s0351.literal: Now Your Majesty possesses all within the seas, yet your sons and younger brothers are commoners; if suddenly there arise ministers like Tian Chang or the Six Ministers, without support and assistance, how will they rescue each other?
s0351.idiomatic: Now Your Majesty possesses all within the seas, yet your sons and younger brothers are commoners; if suddenly there arise ministers like Tian Chang or the Six Ministers, without support and assistance, how will they rescue each other?

s0352.chinese: 事不師古而能長久者，非所聞也。
s0352.literal: That affairs not modeled on antiquity can last long is not what I have heard.
s0352.idiomatic: That affairs not modeled on antiquity can last long is not what I have heard.

s0353.chinese: 今青臣又面諛以重陛下之過，非忠臣。」
s0353.literal: Now Qingchen also flatters you to your face to compound Your Majesty's errors; he is not a loyal minister."
s0353.idiomatic: Now Qingchen also flatters you to your face to compound Your Majesty's errors; he is not a loyal minister."

s0354.literal: The First Emperor submitted this proposal for discussion.
s0354.idiomatic: The First Emperor submitted this proposal for discussion.

s0355.chinese: 丞相李斯曰：「五帝不相復，三代不相襲，各以治，非其相反，時變異也。
s0355.literal: Prime Minister Li Si said: "The Five Emperors did not repeat each other, the Three Dynasties did not follow each other's practices; each governed, not that they contradicted each other, but that times changed and differed.
s0355.idiomatic: Prime Minister Li Si said: "The Five Emperors did not repeat each other, the Three Dynasties did not follow each other's practices; each governed, not that they contradicted each other, but that times changed and differed.

s0356.chinese: 今陛下創大業，建萬世之功，固非愚儒所知。
s0356.literal: Now Your Majesty has created a great enterprise, established achievements for ten thousand generations; this is certainly not what foolish Confucians can understand.
s0356.idiomatic: Now Your Majesty has created a great enterprise, established achievements for ten thousand generations; this is certainly not what foolish Confucians can understand.

s0357.chinese: 且越言乃三代之事，何足法也？
s0357.literal: Moreover, Yue speaks only of the affairs of the Three Dynasties; what is worth modeling?
s0357.idiomatic: Moreover, Yue speaks only of the affairs of the Three Dynasties; what is worth modeling?

s0358.chinese: 異時諸侯并爭，厚招游學。
s0358.literal: In former times when feudal lords competed, they generously recruited traveling scholars.
s0358.idiomatic: In former times when feudal lords competed, they generously recruited traveling scholars.

s0359.chinese: 今天下已定，法令出一，百姓當家則力農工，士則學習法令辟禁。
s0359.literal: Now all under Heaven is already settled, laws and decrees issue from one source; commoners at home should devote themselves to agriculture and industry, scholars should study laws, decrees, prohibitions, and taboos.
s0359.idiomatic: Now all under Heaven is already settled, laws and decrees issue from one source; commoners at home should devote themselves to agriculture and industry, scholars should study laws, decrees, prohibitions, and taboos.

s0360.chinese: 今諸生不師今而學古，以非當世，惑亂黔首。
s0360.literal: Now various scholars do not study the present but study the past, using it to criticize the current age and confuse the black-headed people.
s0360.idiomatic: Now various scholars do not study the present but study the past, using it to criticize the current age and confuse the black-headed people.

s0361.chinese: 丞相臣斯昧死言：古者天下散亂，莫之能一，是以諸侯并作，語皆道古以害今，飾虛言以亂實，人善其所私學，以非上之所建立。
s0361.literal: Prime Minister and your servant Si at risk of death says: In ancient times all under Heaven was scattered and chaotic, none could unify it; therefore feudal lords all acted, their discourse all spoke of antiquity to harm the present, adorned empty words to confuse reality; people praised their own private learning to criticize what the superior had established.
s0361.idiomatic: Prime Minister and your servant Si at risk of death says: In ancient times all under Heaven was scattered and chaotic, none could unify it; therefore feudal lords all acted, their discourse all spoke of antiquity to harm the present, adorned empty words to confuse reality; people praised their own private learning to criticize what the superior had established.

s0362.chinese: 今皇帝并有天下，別黑白而定一尊。
s0362.literal: Now the Emperor possesses all under Heaven, distinguishes black from white, and establishes one supreme authority.
s0362.idiomatic: Now the Emperor possesses all under Heaven, distinguishes black from white, and establishes one supreme authority.

s0363.chinese: 私學而相與非法教，人聞令下，則各以其學議之，入則心非，出則巷議，夸主以為名，異取以為高，率群下以造謗。
s0363.literal: Those who privately study and together criticize the laws and teachings—when people hear decrees issued, each discusses them according to their own learning; entering they mentally oppose it, going out they discuss it in the alleys, boasting before their lord to make a name, taking different positions to seem superior, leading the masses to create slander.
s0363.idiomatic: Those who privately study and together criticize the laws and teachings—when people hear decrees issued, each discusses them according to their own learning; entering they mentally oppose it, going out they discuss it in the alleys, boasting before their lord to make a name, taking different positions to seem superior, leading the masses to create slander.

s0364.chinese: 如此弗禁，則主勢降乎上，黨與成乎下。
s0364.literal: If this is not prohibited, then the lord's power declines above and factions form below.
s0364.idiomatic: If this is not prohibited, then the lord's power declines above and factions form below.

s0366.chinese: 臣請史官非秦記皆燒之。
s0366.literal: Your servant requests that all historical records not of Qin be burned.
s0366.idiomatic: Your servant requests that all historical records not of Qin be burned.

s0367.chinese: 非博士官所職，天下敢有藏詩、書、百家語者，悉詣守、尉雜燒之。
s0367.literal: Except for what the scholars' office is responsible for, if anyone throughout the land dares to possess the Odes, the Documents, or the writings of the hundred schools, they should all be brought to the governor and commandant to be burned together.
s0367.idiomatic: Except for what the scholars' office is responsible for, if anyone throughout the land dares to possess the Odes, the Documents, or the writings of the hundred schools, they should all be brought to the governor and commandant to be burned together.

s0368.literal: Those who dare to discuss the Odes or Documents together will be executed in the marketplace.
s0368.idiomatic: Those who dare to discuss the Odes or Documents together will be executed in the marketplace.

s0369.literal: Those who use antiquity to criticize the present will have their entire clans exterminated.
s0369.idiomatic: Those who use antiquity to criticize the present will have their entire clans exterminated.

s0370.literal: Officials who see and know but do not report will be punished with the same crime.
s0370.idiomatic: Officials who see and know but do not report will be punished with the same crime.

s0371.chinese: 令下三十日不燒，黥為城旦。
s0371.literal: If the decree is issued and after thirty days they have not burned them, they will be tattooed and made to serve as watchmen.
s0371.idiomatic: If the decree is issued and after thirty days they have not burned them, they will be tattooed and made to serve as watchmen.

s0372.chinese: 所不去者，醫藥卜筮種樹之書。
s0372.literal: What will not be eliminated are books on medicine, divination, and agriculture.
s0372.idiomatic: What will not be eliminated are books on medicine, divination, and agriculture.

s0373.chinese: 若欲有學法令，以吏為師。」
s0373.literal: If anyone wishes to study laws and decrees, they should take officials as their teachers."
s0373.idiomatic: If anyone wishes to study laws and decrees, they should take officials as their teachers."

s0376.chinese: 三十五年，除道，道九原抵雲陽，塹山堙谷，直通之。
s0376.literal: In the thirty-fifth year, roads were cleared; the road from Jiuyuan to Yunyang, cutting through mountains and filling valleys, went straight through.
s0376.idiomatic: In the thirty-fifth year, roads were cleared; the road from Jiuyuan to Yunyang, cutting through mountains and filling valleys, went straight through.

s0377.chinese: 於是始皇以為咸陽人多，先王之宮廷小，吾聞周文王都豐，武王都鎬，豐鎬之閒，帝王之都也。
s0377.literal: Thereupon the First Emperor considered that Xianyang had too many people and that the former kings' palaces were too small; he had heard that King Wen of Zhou had his capital at Feng and King Wu at Hao; between Feng and Hao was the imperial capital.
s0377.idiomatic: Thereupon the First Emperor considered that Xianyang had too many people and that the former kings' palaces were too small; he had heard that King Wen of Zhou had his capital at Feng and King Wu at Hao; between Feng and Hao was the imperial capital.

s0378.chinese: 乃營作朝宮渭南上林苑中。
s0378.literal: He then planned to build a palace court south of the Wei River in Shanglinyuan.
s0378.idiomatic: He then planned to build a palace court south of the Wei River in Shanglinyuan.

s0379.chinese: 先作前殿阿房，東西五百步，南北五十丈，上可以坐萬人，下可以建五丈旗。
s0379.literal: First he built the front hall of Epang: five hundred bu from east to west, fifty zhang from south to north; above it could seat ten thousand people, below it could erect fifty-zhang flags.
s0379.idiomatic: First he built the front hall of Epang: five hundred bu from east to west, fifty zhang from south to north; above it could seat ten thousand people, below it could erect fifty-zhang flags.

s0380.chinese: 周馳為閣道，自殿下直抵南山。
s0380.literal: Elevated gallery roads circled around; from the hall they went straight down to South Mountain.
s0380.idiomatic: Elevated gallery roads circled around; from the hall they went straight down to South Mountain.

s0381.literal: The peak of South Mountain was marked as the gate tower.
s0381.idiomatic: The peak of South Mountain was marked as the gate tower.

s0382.chinese: 為復道，自阿房渡渭，屬之咸陽，以象天極閣道絕漢抵營室也。
s0382.literal: An elevated roadway was built from Epang Palace crossing the Wei River, connecting it to Xianyang, symbolizing how the celestial pole's elevated road crosses the Milky Way to reach the Hall of Encampment.
s0382.idiomatic: An elevated roadway was built from Epang Palace crossing the Wei River, connecting it to Xianyang, symbolizing how the celestial pole's elevated road crosses the Milky Way to reach the Hall of Encampment.

s0384.literal: when completed, they wanted to select an auspicious name to name it.
s0384.idiomatic: when completed, they wanted to select an auspicious name to name it.

s0385.chinese: 作宮阿房，故天下謂之阿房宮。
s0385.literal: Because the palace was built at Epang, all under Heaven called it Epang Palace.
s0385.idiomatic: Because the palace was built at Epang, all under Heaven called it Epang Palace.

s0386.chinese: 隱宮徒刑者七十餘萬人，乃分作阿房宮，或作麗山。
s0386.literal: Over seven hundred thousand palace workers and convicts were divided to work on Epang Palace or on Lishan.
s0386.idiomatic: Over seven hundred thousand palace workers and convicts were divided to work on Epang Palace or on Lishan.

s0387.chinese: 發北山石槨，乃寫蜀、荊地材皆至。
s0387.literal: Stone coffins were quarried from North Mountain, and timber from Shu and Jing was all transported there.
s0387.idiomatic: Stone coffins were quarried from North Mountain, and timber from Shu and Jing was all transported there.

s0388.chinese: 關中計宮三百，關外四百餘。
s0388.literal: Within the passes there were three hundred palaces, outside the passes over four hundred.
s0388.idiomatic: Within the passes there were three hundred palaces, outside the passes over four hundred.

s0389.chinese: 於是立石東海上朐界中，以為秦東門。
s0389.literal: Thereupon a stone monument was erected at the eastern sea in Qu border territory, marking it as Qin's Eastern Gate.
s0389.idiomatic: Thereupon a stone monument was erected at the eastern sea in Qu border territory, marking it as Qin's Eastern Gate.

s0390.chinese: 因徙三萬家麗邑，五萬家雲陽，皆復不事十歲。
s0390.literal: He then relocated thirty thousand households to Liyi and fifty thousand households to Yunyang, all exempted from corvée for ten years.
s0390.idiomatic: He then relocated thirty thousand households to Liyi and fifty thousand households to Yunyang, all exempted from corvée for ten years.

s0391.chinese: 盧生說始皇曰：「臣等求芝奇藥僊者常弗遇，類物有害之者。
s0391.literal: Lu Sheng persuaded the First Emperor, saying: "We your servants and others seeking magic mushrooms, rare medicines, and immortals have constantly not encountered them; it seems there are things that harm this.
s0391.idiomatic: Lu Sheng persuaded the First Emperor, saying: "We your servants and others seeking magic mushrooms, rare medicines, and immortals have constantly not encountered them; it seems there are things that harm this.

s0392.chinese: 方中，人主時為微行以辟惡鬼，惡鬼辟，真人至。
s0392.literal: According to the methods, the lord of men should sometimes travel incognito to avoid evil spirits; when evil spirits are avoided, the true person will come.
s0392.idiomatic: According to the methods, the lord of men should sometimes travel incognito to avoid evil spirits; when evil spirits are avoided, the true person will come.

s0393.chinese: 人主所居而人臣知之，則害於神。
s0393.literal: If the lord of men resides somewhere and his ministers know of it, this harms the spirits.
s0393.idiomatic: If the lord of men resides somewhere and his ministers know of it, this harms the spirits.

s0394.chinese: 真人者，入水不濡，入火不爇，陵雲氣，與天地久長。
s0394.literal: A true person enters water without getting wet, enters fire without burning, rides cloud qi, and lives as long as Heaven and Earth.
s0394.idiomatic: A true person enters water without getting wet, enters fire without burning, rides cloud qi, and lives as long as Heaven and Earth.

s0395.literal: Now the superior governs all under Heaven but has not yet achieved tranquility.
s0395.idiomatic: Now the superior governs all under Heaven but has not yet achieved tranquility.

s0396.chinese: 願上所居宮毋令人知，然後不死之藥殆可得也。」
s0396.literal: I hope the superior's residences are not made known to people; only then can the medicine of immortality probably be obtained."
s0396.idiomatic: I hope the superior's residences are not made known to people; only then can the medicine of immortality probably be obtained."

s0397.chinese: 於是始皇曰：「吾慕真人，自謂『真人』，不稱『朕』。」
s0397.literal: Thereupon the First Emperor said: "I admire the true person; I shall call myself 'true person,' not 'zhen.'"
s0397.idiomatic: Thereupon the First Emperor said: "I admire the true person; I shall call myself 'true person,' not 'zhen.'"

s0398.chinese: 乃令咸陽之旁二百里內宮觀二百七十復道甬道相連，帷帳鐘鼓美人充之，各案署不移徙。
s0398.literal: He then ordered that within two hundred li around Xianyang, two hundred seventy palaces and observation towers be connected by elevated roadways and walled passages; curtains, bells, drums, and beautiful women filled them, each assigned by register and not moved.
s0398.idiomatic: He then ordered that within two hundred li around Xianyang, two hundred seventy palaces and observation towers be connected by elevated roadways and walled passages; curtains, bells, drums, and beautiful women filled them, each assigned by register and not moved.

s0399.chinese: 行所幸，有言其處者，罪死。
s0399.literal: Wherever he traveled and stayed, anyone who spoke of his location was punished by death.
s0399.idiomatic: Wherever he traveled and stayed, anyone who spoke of his location was punished by death.

s0400.chinese: 始皇帝幸梁山宮，從山上見丞相車騎眾，弗善也。
s0400.literal: The First Emperor visited Liangshan Palace; from the mountain he saw the prime minister's chariots and cavalry entourage and was displeased.
s0400.idiomatic: The First Emperor visited Liangshan Palace; from the mountain he saw the prime minister's chariots and cavalry entourage and was displeased.

s0401.chinese: 中人或告丞相，丞相後損車騎。
s0401.literal: Someone among the palace attendants informed the prime minister, and the prime minister later reduced his chariots and cavalry.
s0401.idiomatic: Someone among the palace attendants informed the prime minister, and the prime minister later reduced his chariots and cavalry.

s0402.chinese: 始皇怒曰：「此中人泄吾語。」
s0402.literal: The First Emperor was angry and said: "Someone among the palace attendants leaked my words."
s0402.idiomatic: The First Emperor was angry and said: "Someone among the palace attendants leaked my words."

s0403.literal: He investigated and questioned them, but none confessed.
s0403.idiomatic: He investigated and questioned them, but none confessed.

s0404.chinese: 當是時，詔捕諸時在旁者，皆殺之。
s0404.literal: At that time, he decreed the arrest of all those who were nearby at the time, and they were all killed.
s0404.idiomatic: At that time, he decreed the arrest of all those who were nearby at the time, and they were all killed.

s0405.literal: From then on, no one knew where he traveled.
s0405.idiomatic: From then on, no one knew where he traveled.

s0406.chinese: 聽事，群臣受決事，悉於咸陽宮。
s0406.literal: When he attended to affairs, the assembled ministers received decisions on matters all at Xianyang Palace.
s0406.idiomatic: When he attended to affairs, the assembled ministers received decisions on matters all at Xianyang Palace.

s0407.chinese: 侯生盧生相與謀曰：「始皇為人，天性剛戾自用，起諸侯，并天下，意得欲從，以為自古莫及己。
s0407.literal: Hou Sheng and Lu Sheng plotted together, saying: "The First Emperor is by nature rigid, cruel, and self-willed; rising from among the feudal lords and unifying all under Heaven, his will satisfied and desires fulfilled, he considers that from ancient times none equal him.
s0407.idiomatic: Hou Sheng and Lu Sheng plotted together, saying: "The First Emperor is by nature rigid, cruel, and self-willed; rising from among the feudal lords and unifying all under Heaven, his will satisfied and desires fulfilled, he considers that from ancient times none equal him.

s0408.literal: He exclusively employs judicial officials, and judicial officials obtain favor and privilege.
s0408.idiomatic: He exclusively employs judicial officials, and judicial officials obtain favor and privilege.

s0409.chinese: 博士雖七十人，特備員弗用。
s0409.literal: Although there are seventy scholars, they merely fill positions and are not employed.
s0409.idiomatic: Although there are seventy scholars, they merely fill positions and are not employed.

s0410.chinese: 丞相諸大臣皆受成事，倚辨於上。
s0410.literal: The prime minister and all great ministers merely receive accomplished tasks and depend on decisions from above.
s0410.idiomatic: The prime minister and all great ministers merely receive accomplished tasks and depend on decisions from above.

s0411.chinese: 上樂以刑殺為威，天下畏罪持祿，莫敢盡忠。
s0411.literal: The superior delights in using punishment and execution as authority; all under Heaven fear punishment and cling to their salaries; none dare exhaust their loyalty.
s0411.idiomatic: The superior delights in using punishment and execution as authority; all under Heaven fear punishment and cling to their salaries; none dare exhaust their loyalty.

s0412.chinese: 上不聞過而日驕，下懾伏謾欺以取容。
s0412.literal: The superior does not hear of faults and daily becomes more arrogant; below they cower in submission and deceive to gain favor.
s0412.idiomatic: The superior does not hear of faults and daily becomes more arrogant; below they cower in submission and deceive to gain favor.

s0413.chinese: 秦法，不得兼方不驗，輒死。
s0413.literal: By Qin law, if one practices multiple methods that are not verified, one is immediately executed.
s0413.idiomatic: By Qin law, if one practices multiple methods that are not verified, one is immediately executed.

s0414.chinese: 然候星氣者至三百人，皆良士，畏忌諱諛，不敢端言其過。
s0414.literal: Yet those who observe stars and qi number up to three hundred, all excellent men; fearing taboos they flatter, not daring to directly speak of his faults.
s0414.idiomatic: Yet those who observe stars and qi number up to three hundred, all excellent men; fearing taboos they flatter, not daring to directly speak of his faults.

s0415.chinese: 天下之事無小大皆決於上，上至以衡石量書，日夜有呈，不中呈不得休息。
s0415.literal: All affairs of the land, great and small, are all decided by the superior; the superior even weighs documents by the shi; day and night there are quotas; if the quota is not met he cannot rest.
s0415.idiomatic: All affairs of the land, great and small, are all decided by the superior; the superior even weighs documents by the shi; day and night there are quotas; if the quota is not met he cannot rest.

s0416.chinese: 貪於權勢至如此，未可為求僊藥。」
s0416.literal: His greed for power and authority is like this; he cannot be approached to seek the medicine of immortality."
s0416.idiomatic: His greed for power and authority is like this; he cannot be approached to seek the medicine of immortality."

s0418.chinese: 始皇聞亡，乃大怒曰：「吾前收天下書不中用者盡去之。
s0418.literal: When the First Emperor heard of their flight, he became greatly angry and said: "I previously collected books from all under Heaven that were useless and eliminated them all.
s0418.idiomatic: When the First Emperor heard of their flight, he became greatly angry and said: "I previously collected books from all under Heaven that were useless and eliminated them all.

s0419.chinese: 悉召文學方術士甚眾，欲以興太平，方士欲練以求奇藥。
s0419.literal: I summoned literary scholars and practitioners of methods in great numbers, wishing to promote great peace; the practitioners of methods wished to refine themselves to seek rare medicines.
s0419.idiomatic: I summoned literary scholars and practitioners of methods in great numbers, wishing to promote great peace; the practitioners of methods wished to refine themselves to seek rare medicines.

s0420.chinese: 今聞韓眾去不報，徐市等費以巨萬計，終不得藥，徒姦利相告日聞。
s0420.literal: Now I hear that Han Zhong has left without reporting; Xu Shi and others have spent enormous amounts, yet have never obtained the medicine; they only practice deception for profit, reporting to each other daily.
s0420.idiomatic: Now I hear that Han Zhong has left without reporting; Xu Shi and others have spent enormous amounts, yet have never obtained the medicine; they only practice deception for profit, reporting to each other daily.

s0421.chinese: 盧生等吾尊賜之甚厚，今乃誹謗我，以重吾不德也。
s0421.literal: I honored and bestowed upon Lu Sheng and others very generously, yet now they slander me, compounding my lack of virtue.
s0421.idiomatic: I honored and bestowed upon Lu Sheng and others very generously, yet now they slander me, compounding my lack of virtue.

s0422.chinese: 諸生在咸陽者，吾使人廉問，或為訞言以亂黔首。」
s0422.literal: As for the scholars in Xianyang, I sent people to investigate; some spread false words to confuse the black-headed people."
s0422.idiomatic: As for the scholars in Xianyang, I sent people to investigate; some spread false words to confuse the black-headed people."

s0423.chinese: 於是使御史悉案問諸生，諸生傳相告引，乃自除犯禁者四百六十餘人，皆阬之咸陽，使天下知之，以懲後。
s0423.literal: Thereupon he sent the censors to thoroughly investigate all the scholars; the scholars implicated each other; he then personally eliminated over four hundred sixty who violated prohibitions, buried them all alive at Xianyang, and made all under Heaven know of it, to warn those after.
s0423.idiomatic: Thereupon he sent the censors to thoroughly investigate all the scholars; the scholars implicated each other; he then personally eliminated over four hundred sixty who violated prohibitions, buried them all alive at Xianyang, and made all under Heaven know of it, to warn those after.

s0424.literal: He increased the dispatch of exiled convicts to the borders.
s0424.idiomatic: He increased the dispatch of exiled convicts to the borders.

s0425.chinese: 始皇長子扶蘇諫曰：「天下初定，遠方黔首未集，諸生皆誦法孔子，今上皆重法繩之，臣恐天下不安。
s0425.literal: The First Emperor's eldest son Fusu remonstrated, saying: "All under Heaven has just been pacified; the black-headed people in distant regions have not yet been unified; all the scholars recite the methods of Confucius; now if the superior uses heavy punishments to bind them all, I fear all under Heaven will not be peaceful.
s0425.idiomatic: The First Emperor's eldest son Fusu remonstrated, saying: "All under Heaven has just been pacified; the black-headed people in distant regions have not yet been unified; all the scholars recite the methods of Confucius; now if the superior uses heavy punishments to bind them all, I fear all under Heaven will not be peaceful.

s0426.literal: I hope the superior will examine this."
s0426.idiomatic: I hope the superior will examine this."

s0427.chinese: 始皇怒，使扶蘇北監蒙恬於上郡。
s0427.literal: The First Emperor was angry and sent Fusu north to oversee Meng Tian at Shangjun.
s0427.idiomatic: The First Emperor was angry and sent Fusu north to oversee Meng Tian at Shangjun.

s0428.literal: In the thirty-sixth year, Mars remained in the Heart constellation.
s0428.idiomatic: In the thirty-sixth year, Mars remained in the Heart constellation.

s0429.chinese: 有墜星下東郡，至地為石，黔首或刻其石曰「始皇帝死而地分」。
s0429.literal: A meteorite fell in Dongjun; when it reached the ground and became stone, some among the black-headed people carved on the stone: 'The First Emperor will die and the land will be divided.'
s0429.idiomatic: A meteorite fell in Dongjun; when it reached the ground and became stone, some among the black-headed people carved on the stone: 'The First Emperor will die and the land will be divided.'

s0430.chinese: 始皇聞之，遣御史逐問，莫服，盡取石旁居人誅之，因燔銷其石。
s0430.literal: When the First Emperor heard of this, he sent censors to pursue and question them; none confessed, so he seized all the residents near the stone and executed them, then burned and melted the stone.
s0430.idiomatic: When the First Emperor heard of this, he sent censors to pursue and question them; none confessed, so he seized all the residents near the stone and executed them, then burned and melted the stone.

s0431.chinese: 始皇不樂，使博士為僊真人詩，及行所游天下，傳令樂人歌弦之。
s0431.literal: The First Emperor was displeased; he had scholars compose poems about immortals and true persons, and as he traveled throughout the land, had musicians sing and play them.
s0431.idiomatic: The First Emperor was displeased; he had scholars compose poems about immortals and true persons, and as he traveled throughout the land, had musicians sing and play them.

s0432.chinese: 秋，使者從關東夜過華陰平舒道，有人持璧遮使者曰：「為吾遺滈池君。」
s0432.literal: In autumn, an envoy from east of the passes at night passed through Huayin on the Pingshu road; someone holding a jade disk blocked the envoy and said: "Give this to the Lord of Haochi for me."
s0432.idiomatic: In autumn, an envoy from east of the passes at night passed through Huayin on the Pingshu road; someone holding a jade disk blocked the envoy and said: "Give this to the Lord of Haochi for me."

s0433.literal: He then said: "This year the ancestral dragon will die."
s0433.idiomatic: He then said: "This year the ancestral dragon will die."

s0434.chinese: 使者問其故，因忽不見，置其璧去。
s0434.literal: The envoy asked why, but the person suddenly disappeared, leaving the jade disk.
s0434.idiomatic: The envoy asked why, but the person suddenly disappeared, leaving the jade disk.

s0435.literal: The envoy presented the jade disk and reported everything he had heard.
s0435.idiomatic: The envoy presented the jade disk and reported everything he had heard.

s0436.chinese: 始皇默然良久，曰：「山鬼固不過知一歲事也。」
s0436.literal: The First Emperor was silent for a long while, then said: "Mountain spirits can only know one year's events."
s0436.idiomatic: The First Emperor was silent for a long while, then said: "Mountain spirits can only know one year's events."

s0437.chinese: 退言曰：「祖龍者，人之先也。」
s0437.literal: Withdrawing he said: "The ancestral dragon refers to the ancestor of men."
s0437.idiomatic: Withdrawing he said: "The ancestral dragon refers to the ancestor of men."

s0438.chinese: 使御府視璧，乃二十八年行渡江所沈璧也。
s0438.literal: He had the imperial treasury examine the jade disk; it was the disk that had been cast into the river when crossing the Yangtze in the twenty-eighth year.
s0438.idiomatic: He had the imperial treasury examine the jade disk; it was the disk that had been cast into the river when crossing the Yangtze in the twenty-eighth year.

s0439.chinese: 於是始皇卜之，卦得游徙吉。
s0439.literal: Thereupon the First Emperor divined; the divination yielded that traveling and relocating were auspicious.
s0439.idiomatic: Thereupon the First Emperor divined; the divination yielded that traveling and relocating were auspicious.

s0440.literal: He relocated thirty thousand households north of the Yellow River to Yuzhong.
s0440.idiomatic: He relocated thirty thousand households north of the Yellow River to Yuzhong.

s0441.literal: He granted one rank of nobility.
s0441.idiomatic: He granted one rank of nobility.

s0442.chinese: 三十七年十月癸丑，始皇出游。
s0442.literal: On the guichou day of the tenth month of the thirty-seventh year, the First Emperor set out on a tour.
s0442.idiomatic: On the guichou day of the tenth month of the thirty-seventh year, the First Emperor set out on a tour.

s0443.chinese: 左丞相斯從，右丞相去疾守。
s0443.literal: Left Prime Minister Si accompanied him; Right Prime Minister Quji remained to guard.
s0443.idiomatic: Left Prime Minister Si accompanied him; Right Prime Minister Quji remained to guard.

s0444.chinese: 少子胡亥愛慕請從，上許之。
s0444.literal: His youngest son Huhai, longing to go, requested to accompany him, and the emperor permitted it.
s0444.idiomatic: His youngest son Huhai, longing to go, requested to accompany him, and the emperor permitted it.

s0445.chinese: 十一月，行至雲夢，望祀虞舜於九疑山。
s0445.literal: In the eleventh month, they traveled to Yunmeng and made distant offerings to Yu Shun at Jiuyi Mountain.
s0445.idiomatic: In the eleventh month, they traveled to Yunmeng and made distant offerings to Yu Shun at Jiuyi Mountain.

s0446.literal: Floating down the Yangtze, he observed Jike and crossed sea islets.
s0446.idiomatic: Floating down the Yangtze, he observed Jike and crossed sea islets.

s0447.literal: He passed Danyang and reached Qiantang.
s0447.idiomatic: He passed Danyang and reached Qiantang.

s0448.chinese: 臨浙江，水波惡，乃西百二十里從狹中渡。
s0448.literal: Approaching the Zhe River, the water's waves were treacherous, so he went west one hundred twenty li and crossed through a narrow passage.
s0448.idiomatic: Approaching the Zhe River, the water's waves were treacherous, so he went west one hundred twenty li and crossed through a narrow passage.

s0449.chinese: 上會稽，祭大禹，望于南海，而立石刻頌秦德。
s0449.literal: He ascended Kuaiji, made sacrifices to the Great Yu, gazed upon the Southern Sea, and erected stone inscriptions praising Qin's virtue.
s0449.idiomatic: He ascended Kuaiji, made sacrifices to the Great Yu, gazed upon the Southern Sea, and erected stone inscriptions praising Qin's virtue.

s0451.chinese: 皇帝休烈，平一宇內，德惠修長。
s0451.literal: The Emperor's splendid achievements unified all within the universe; his virtue and beneficence are cultivated and enduring.
s0451.idiomatic: The Emperor's splendid achievements unified all within the universe; his virtue and beneficence are cultivated and enduring.

s0452.chinese: 三十有七年，親巡天下，周覽遠方。
s0452.literal: In the thirty-seventh year, he personally toured all under Heaven, comprehensively surveying distant regions.
s0452.idiomatic: In the thirty-seventh year, he personally toured all under Heaven, comprehensively surveying distant regions.

s0453.chinese: 遂登會稽，宣省習俗，黔首齋莊。
s0453.literal: He then ascended Kuaiji, proclaimed and inspected customs; the black-headed people were reverent and solemn.
s0453.idiomatic: He then ascended Kuaiji, proclaimed and inspected customs; the black-headed people were reverent and solemn.

s0454.chinese: 群臣誦功，本原事跡，追首高明。
s0454.literal: The assembled ministers recited his achievements, traced the origins of events, and pursued his lofty brilliance.
s0454.idiomatic: The assembled ministers recited his achievements, traced the origins of events, and pursued his lofty brilliance.

s0455.chinese: 秦聖臨國，始定刑名，顯陳舊章。
s0455.literal: The Qin sage governed the state, first established criminal names, and clearly displayed ancient regulations.
s0455.idiomatic: The Qin sage governed the state, first established criminal names, and clearly displayed ancient regulations.

s0456.chinese: 初平法式，審別職任，以立恒常。
s0456.literal: Initially he leveled laws and regulations, carefully distinguished official duties, to establish permanent standards.
s0456.idiomatic: Initially he leveled laws and regulations, carefully distinguished official duties, to establish permanent standards.

s0457.chinese: 六王專倍，貪戾傲猛，率眾自彊。
s0457.literal: The six kings were monopolistic and treacherous, greedy, cruel, arrogant, and fierce, leading masses to strengthen themselves.
s0457.idiomatic: The six kings were monopolistic and treacherous, greedy, cruel, arrogant, and fierce, leading masses to strengthen themselves.

s0458.chinese: 暴虐恣行，負力而驕，數動甲兵。
s0458.literal: Violent and tyrannical, they acted with abandon, relying on force they were arrogant, frequently mobilizing troops.
s0458.idiomatic: Violent and tyrannical, they acted with abandon, relying on force they were arrogant, frequently mobilizing troops.

s0459.chinese: 陰通閒使，以事合從，行為辟方。
s0459.literal: Secretly they sent covert envoys, using affairs to form vertical alliances, acting in devious ways.
s0459.idiomatic: Secretly they sent covert envoys, using affairs to form vertical alliances, acting in devious ways.

s0460.chinese: 內飾詐謀，外來侵邊，遂起禍殃。
s0460.literal: Internally they adorned themselves with deceitful plots, externally they came to invade borders, thereby bringing about disaster.
s0460.idiomatic: Internally they adorned themselves with deceitful plots, externally they came to invade borders, thereby bringing about disaster.

s0461.chinese: 義威誅之，殄熄暴悖，亂賊滅亡。
s0461.literal: With righteous authority he executed them, completely extinguished violent rebels; chaotic traitors were destroyed.
s0461.idiomatic: With righteous authority he executed them, completely extinguished violent rebels; chaotic traitors were destroyed.

s0462.chinese: 聖德廣密，六合之中，被澤無疆。
s0462.literal: His sage virtue was broadly profound; within the six directions, his beneficence spread without limit.
s0462.idiomatic: His sage virtue was broadly profound; within the six directions, his beneficence spread without limit.

s0463.chinese: 皇帝并宇，兼聽萬事，遠近畢清。
s0463.literal: The Emperor unified the universe, comprehensively attended to all affairs; far and near all were thoroughly purified.
s0463.idiomatic: The Emperor unified the universe, comprehensively attended to all affairs; far and near all were thoroughly purified.

s0464.chinese: 運理群物，考驗事實，各載其名。
s0464.literal: Managing and governing the multitude of things, examining and verifying actual affairs, each bearing its name.
s0464.idiomatic: Managing and governing the multitude of things, examining and verifying actual affairs, each bearing its name.

s0465.chinese: 貴賤并通，善否陳前，靡有隱情。
s0465.literal: Noble and base both communicated, good and bad were displayed before him; there was nothing hidden.
s0465.idiomatic: Noble and base both communicated, good and bad were displayed before him; there was nothing hidden.

s0466.chinese: 飾省宣義，有子而嫁，倍死不貞。
s0466.literal: He adorned, examined, and proclaimed righteousness: having a son yet marrying another, betraying the deceased, being unchaste.
s0466.idiomatic: He adorned, examined, and proclaimed righteousness: having a son yet marrying another, betraying the deceased, being unchaste.

s0467.chinese: 防隔內外，禁止淫泆，男女絜誠。
s0467.literal: Separating inside and outside, prohibiting and stopping licentiousness; men and women were pure and sincere.
s0467.idiomatic: Separating inside and outside, prohibiting and stopping licentiousness; men and women were pure and sincere.

s0468.chinese: 夫為寄豭，殺之無罪，男秉義程。
s0468.literal: If a husband was a stud boar, killing him incurred no punishment; males held to the righteous standard.
s0468.idiomatic: If a husband was a stud boar, killing him incurred no punishment; males held to the righteous standard.

s0469.chinese: 妻為逃嫁，子不得母，咸化廉清。
s0469.literal: If a wife eloped, the son could not obtain his mother; all were transformed to be honest and pure.
s0469.idiomatic: If a wife eloped, the son could not obtain his mother; all were transformed to be honest and pure.

s0470.chinese: 大治濯俗，天下承風，蒙被休經。
s0470.literal: Greatly governing and purifying customs, all under Heaven received the wind of transformation, bathed in his splendid teachings.
s0470.idiomatic: Greatly governing and purifying customs, all under Heaven received the wind of transformation, bathed in his splendid teachings.

s0471.chinese: 皆遵度軌，和安敦勉，莫不順令。
s0471.literal: All followed the standards and regulations, harmonious, peaceful, sincere, and diligent; none did not obey commands.
s0471.idiomatic: All followed the standards and regulations, harmonious, peaceful, sincere, and diligent; none did not obey commands.

s0472.chinese: 黔首修絜，人樂同則，嘉保太平。
s0472.literal: The black-headed people cultivated purity; people delighted in common standards, joyfully preserving great peace.
s0472.idiomatic: The black-headed people cultivated purity; people delighted in common standards, joyfully preserving great peace.

s0473.chinese: 後敬奉法，常治無極，輿舟不傾。
s0473.literal: Later generations respectfully uphold the laws, constantly governing without end; boats and chariots do not overturn.
s0473.idiomatic: Later generations respectfully uphold the laws, constantly governing without end; boats and chariots do not overturn.

s0474.chinese: 從臣誦烈，請刻此石，光垂休銘。
s0474.literal: The attending ministers recite his achievements and request to carve this stone, gloriously displaying the splendid inscription.
s0474.idiomatic: The attending ministers recite his achievements and request to carve this stone, gloriously displaying the splendid inscription.

s0475.literal: Returning, he passed through Wu and crossed from Jiangcheng.
s0475.idiomatic: Returning, he passed through Wu and crossed from Jiangcheng.

s0476.literal: He went up along the sea and north to Langye.
s0476.idiomatic: He went up along the sea and north to Langye.

s0477.chinese: 方士徐市等入海求神藥，數歲不得，費多，恐譴，乃詐曰：「蓬萊藥可得，然常為大鮫魚所苦，故不得至，願請善射與俱，見則以連弩射之。」
s0477.literal: The practitioner Xu Shi and others entered the sea seeking divine medicine; after several years without obtaining it and having spent much, fearing punishment, they fabricated a story: "The Penglai medicine can be obtained, but we are constantly troubled by large sharks, so we cannot reach it; we request good archers to accompany us; when we see them we will shoot them with multiple crossbows."
s0477.idiomatic: The practitioner Xu Shi and others entered the sea seeking divine medicine; after several years without obtaining it and having spent much, fearing punishment, they fabricated a story: "The Penglai medicine can be obtained, but we are constantly troubled by large sharks, so we cannot reach it; we request good archers to accompany us; when we see them we will shoot them with multiple crossbows."

s0478.chinese: 始皇夢與海神戰，如人狀。
s0478.literal: The First Emperor dreamed of battling a sea god in human form.
s0478.idiomatic: The First Emperor dreamed of battling a sea god in human form.

s0479.chinese: 問占夢，博士曰：「水神不可見，以大魚蛟龍為候。
s0479.literal: He inquired about dream interpretation; the scholars said: "Water gods cannot be seen; they use large fish and flood dragons as their manifestations.
s0479.idiomatic: He inquired about dream interpretation; the scholars said: "Water gods cannot be seen; they use large fish and flood dragons as their manifestations.

s0480.chinese: 今上禱祠備謹，而有此惡神，當除去，而善神可致。」
s0480.literal: Now the superior's prayers and offerings are thorough and respectful, yet there is this evil god; it should be removed, and good gods can be attracted."
s0480.idiomatic: Now the superior's prayers and offerings are thorough and respectful, yet there is this evil god; it should be removed, and good gods can be attracted."

s0481.chinese: 乃令入海者齎捕巨魚具，而自以連弩候大魚出射之。
s0481.literal: He then ordered those entering the sea to carry equipment for catching giant fish, and he himself waited with multiple crossbows for large fish to appear and shot them.
s0481.idiomatic: He then ordered those entering the sea to carry equipment for catching giant fish, and he himself waited with multiple crossbows for large fish to appear and shot them.

s0482.chinese: 自瑯邪北至榮成山，弗見。
s0482.literal: From Langye north to Rongcheng Mountain, he saw none.
s0482.idiomatic: From Langye north to Rongcheng Mountain, he saw none.

s0483.chinese: 至之罘，見巨魚，射殺一魚。
s0483.literal: At Zhifu, he saw a giant fish and shot and killed one fish.
s0483.idiomatic: At Zhifu, he saw a giant fish and shot and killed one fish.

s0484.literal: He then went west along the sea.
s0484.idiomatic: He then went west along the sea.

s0485.literal: At Pingyuan ford he fell ill.
s0485.idiomatic: At Pingyuan ford he fell ill.

s0486.chinese: 始皇惡言死，群臣莫敢言死事。
s0486.literal: The First Emperor hated speaking of death, and none of the assembled ministers dared speak of death matters.
s0486.idiomatic: The First Emperor hated speaking of death, and none of the assembled ministers dared speak of death matters.

s0487.chinese: 上病益甚，乃為璽書賜公子扶蘇曰：「與喪會咸陽而葬。」
s0487.literal: The emperor's illness grew worse, so he composed a sealed edict to Prince Fusu saying: "Attend the funeral at Xianyang and perform the burial."
s0487.idiomatic: The emperor's illness grew worse, so he composed a sealed edict to Prince Fusu saying: "Attend the funeral at Xianyang and perform the burial."

s0488.chinese: 書已封，在中車府令趙高行符璽事所，未授使者。
s0488.literal: The document was already sealed and was with Director of the Imperial Carriage Zhao Gao who handled seal matters, but had not yet been given to the envoy.
s0488.idiomatic: The document was already sealed and was with Director of the Imperial Carriage Zhao Gao who handled seal matters, but had not yet been given to the envoy.

s0489.chinese: 七月丙寅，始皇崩於沙丘平臺。
s0489.literal: On the bingyin day of the seventh month, the First Emperor died at the Pingtai of Shaqiu.
s0489.idiomatic: On the bingyin day of the seventh month, the First Emperor died at the Pingtai of Shaqiu.

s0490.chinese: 丞相斯為上崩在外，恐諸公子及天下有變，乃祕之，不發喪。
s0490.literal: Prime Minister Si, because the emperor died away from the capital, feared that the princes and all under Heaven would revolt, so he kept it secret and did not announce the death.
s0490.idiomatic: Prime Minister Si, because the emperor died away from the capital, feared that the princes and all under Heaven would revolt, so he kept it secret and did not announce the death.

s0491.chinese: 棺載轀涼車中，故幸宦者參乘，所至上食。
s0491.literal: The coffin was placed in a warm-cool carriage; his formerly favored eunuchs attended; wherever they arrived food was presented to the emperor.
s0491.idiomatic: The coffin was placed in a warm-cool carriage; his formerly favored eunuchs attended; wherever they arrived food was presented to the emperor.

s0492.chinese: 百官奏事如故，宦者輒從轀涼車中可其奏事。
s0492.literal: The hundred officials submitted memorials as usual, and eunuchs from within the warm-cool carriage would approve the submitted memorials.
s0492.idiomatic: The hundred officials submitted memorials as usual, and eunuchs from within the warm-cool carriage would approve the submitted memorials.

s0493.chinese: 獨子胡亥、趙高及所幸宦者五六人知上死。
s0493.literal: Only Prince Huhai, Zhao Gao, and five or six favored eunuchs knew the emperor had died.
s0493.idiomatic: Only Prince Huhai, Zhao Gao, and five or six favored eunuchs knew the emperor had died.

s0494.chinese: 趙高故嘗教胡亥書及獄律令法事，胡亥私幸之。
s0494.literal: Zhao Gao had formerly taught Huhai writing and prison law matters, and Huhai privately favored him.
s0494.idiomatic: Zhao Gao had formerly taught Huhai writing and prison law matters, and Huhai privately favored him.

s0495.chinese: 高乃與公子胡亥、丞相斯陰謀破去始皇所封書賜公子扶蘇者，而更詐為丞相斯受始皇遺詔沙丘，立子胡亥為太子。
s0495.literal: Gao then secretly plotted with Prince Huhai and Prime Minister Si to destroy the sealed document the First Emperor had given to Prince Fusu, and instead forged a decree saying Prime Minister Si had received the First Emperor's last testament at Shaqiu to install Prince Huhai as crown prince.
s0495.idiomatic: Gao then secretly plotted with Prince Huhai and Prime Minister Si to destroy the sealed document the First Emperor had given to Prince Fusu, and instead forged a decree saying Prime Minister Si had received the First Emperor's last testament at Shaqiu to install Prince Huhai as crown prince.

s0496.chinese: 更為書賜公子扶蘇、蒙恬，數以罪，（其）賜死。
s0496.literal: They forged another document to be given to Prince Fusu and Meng Tian, listing their crimes and bestowing death upon them.
s0496.idiomatic: They forged another document to be given to Prince Fusu and Meng Tian, listing their crimes and bestowing death upon them.

s0497.literal: The full account is in the biography of Li Si.
s0497.idiomatic: The full account is in the biography of Li Si.

s0498.literal: They traveled on, passing through Jingxing to reach Jiuyuan.
s0498.idiomatic: They traveled on, passing through Jingxing to reach Jiuyuan.

s0499.chinese: 會暑，上轀車臭，乃詔從官令車載一石鮑魚，以亂其臭。
s0499.literal: With the heat of summer, the warm carriage with the corpse stank, so they decreed that attending officials should have each carriage carry one shi of salted fish to mask the smell.
s0499.idiomatic: With the heat of summer, the warm carriage with the corpse stank, so they decreed that attending officials should have each carriage carry one shi of salted fish to mask the smell.

s0500.literal: They traveled via the straight road to Xianyang and announced the death.
s0500.idiomatic: They traveled via the straight road to Xianyang and announced the death.

s0501.chinese: 太子胡亥襲位，為二世皇帝。
s0501.literal: Crown Prince Huhai succeeded to the throne as the Second Generation Emperor.
s0501.idiomatic: Crown Prince Huhai succeeded to the throne as the Second Generation Emperor.

s0502.literal: In the ninth month, the First Emperor was buried at Lishan.
s0502.idiomatic: In the ninth month, the First Emperor was buried at Lishan.

s0503.chinese: 始皇初即位，穿治酈山，及并天下，天下徒送詣七十餘萬人，穿三泉，下銅而致槨，宮觀百官奇器珍怪徙臧滿之。
s0503.literal: When the First Emperor first ascended the throne, he began excavating and constructing at Lishan; when he unified all under Heaven, convicts sent from throughout the land numbered over seven hundred thousand; they dug through three underground springs, poured copper and placed the coffin chamber, and filled it with palaces, officials, rare implements, and precious curiosities relocated there.
s0503.idiomatic: When the First Emperor first ascended the throne, he began excavating and constructing at Lishan; when he unified all under Heaven, convicts sent from throughout the land numbered over seven hundred thousand; they dug through three underground springs, poured copper and placed the coffin chamber, and filled it with palaces, officials, rare implements, and precious curiosities relocated there.

s0504.chinese: 令匠作機弩矢，有所穿近者輒射之。
s0504.literal: He ordered craftsmen to make mechanical crossbows and arrows; if anyone came near to penetrate, they would immediately shoot them.
s0504.idiomatic: He ordered craftsmen to make mechanical crossbows and arrows; if anyone came near to penetrate, they would immediately shoot them.

s0505.chinese: 以水銀為百川江河大海，機相灌輸，上具天文，下具地理。
s0505.literal: With mercury they made the hundred rivers, the Yangtze and Yellow rivers, and the great sea, with mechanisms that made them flow into each other; above they depicted the heavenly bodies, below they depicted the geography.
s0505.idiomatic: With mercury they made the hundred rivers, the Yangtze and Yellow rivers, and the great sea, with mechanisms that made them flow into each other; above they depicted the heavenly bodies, below they depicted the geography.

s0506.chinese: 以人魚膏為燭，度不滅者久之。
s0506.literal: Using mermaid oil as candles, they calculated they would not be extinguished for a long time.
s0506.idiomatic: Using mermaid oil as candles, they calculated they would not be extinguished for a long time.

s0507.chinese: 二世曰：「先帝後宮非有子者，出焉不宜。」
s0507.literal: The Second Emperor said: "The former emperor's rear palace—those who had no sons should not go out; this would not be proper."
s0507.idiomatic: The Second Emperor said: "The former emperor's rear palace—those who had no sons should not go out; this would not be proper."

s0508.literal: He ordered them all to follow him in death; those who died were very numerous.
s0508.idiomatic: He ordered them all to follow him in death; those who died were very numerous.

s0509.chinese: 葬既已下，或言工匠為機，臧皆知之，臧重即泄。
s0509.literal: After the burial had been completed, someone said that the craftsmen who made the mechanisms all knew what was stored, and if what was stored became known it would be revealed.
s0509.idiomatic: After the burial had been completed, someone said that the craftsmen who made the mechanisms all knew what was stored, and if what was stored became known it would be revealed.

s0510.chinese: 大事畢，已臧，閉中羨，下外羨門，盡閉工匠臧者，無復出者。
s0510.literal: When the great affair was completed and storage finished, they closed the middle passage door and lowered the outer passage door, completely sealing in all the craftsmen and those who stored treasures; none ever came out again.
s0510.idiomatic: When the great affair was completed and storage finished, they closed the middle passage door and lowered the outer passage door, completely sealing in all the craftsmen and those who stored treasures; none ever came out again.

s0511.literal: Trees and grass were planted to simulate mountains.
s0511.idiomatic: Trees and grass were planted to simulate mountains.

s0512.chinese: 二世皇帝元年，年二十一。
s0512.literal: In the first year of the Second Generation Emperor, he was twenty-one years old.
s0512.idiomatic: In the first year of the Second Generation Emperor, he was twenty-one years old.

s0513.literal: Zhao Gao served as Palace Attendant Commander and handled affairs.
s0513.idiomatic: Zhao Gao served as Palace Attendant Commander and handled affairs.

s0514.chinese: 二世下詔，增始皇寢廟犧牲及山川百祀之禮。
s0514.literal: The Second Emperor issued a decree increasing sacrificial animals for the First Emperor's mortuary temple and the rituals for mountains, rivers, and the hundred spirits.
s0514.idiomatic: The Second Emperor issued a decree increasing sacrificial animals for the First Emperor's mortuary temple and the rituals for mountains, rivers, and the hundred spirits.

s0515.literal: He ordered the assembled ministers to discuss honoring the First Emperor's temple.
s0515.idiomatic: He ordered the assembled ministers to discuss honoring the First Emperor's temple.

s0516.chinese: 群臣皆頓首言曰：「古者天子七廟，諸侯五，大夫三，雖萬世世不軼毀。
s0516.literal: All the assembled ministers bowed their heads and said: "In ancient times the Son of Heaven had seven temples, feudal lords five, great officials three; even for ten thousand generations they would never be removed or destroyed.
s0516.idiomatic: All the assembled ministers bowed their heads and said: "In ancient times the Son of Heaven had seven temples, feudal lords five, great officials three; even for ten thousand generations they would never be removed or destroyed.

s0517.chinese: 今始皇為極廟，四海之內皆獻貢職，增犧牲，禮咸備，毋以加。
