s0517.literal: Now the First Emperor is the supreme temple; all within the four seas present tribute and duties, increase sacrificial animals, rituals are all complete; nothing can be added.
s0517.idiomatic: Now the First Emperor is the supreme temple; all within the four seas present tribute and duties, increase sacrificial animals, rituals are all complete; nothing can be added.

s0518.chinese: 先王廟或在西雍，或在咸陽。
s0518.literal: The former kings' temples are either at Western Yong or at Xianyang.
s0518.idiomatic: The former kings' temples are either at Western Yong or at Xianyang.

s0519.chinese: 天子儀當獨奉酌祠始皇廟。
s0519.literal: According to the Son of Heaven's ritual protocol, he should uniquely offer libations and make offerings at the First Emperor's temple.
s0519.idiomatic: According to the Son of Heaven's ritual protocol, he should uniquely offer libations and make offerings at the First Emperor's temple.

s0520.literal: From Xianggong downward they may be removed and destroyed.
s0520.idiomatic: From Xianggong downward they may be removed and destroyed.

s0521.literal: In total seven temples were established.
s0521.idiomatic: In total seven temples were established.

s0522.chinese: 群臣以禮進祠，以尊始皇廟為帝者祖廟。
s0522.literal: The assembled ministers according to ritual advance to make offerings, honoring the First Emperor's temple as the ancestral temple of the emperor.
s0522.idiomatic: The assembled ministers according to ritual advance to make offerings, honoring the First Emperor's temple as the ancestral temple of the emperor.

s0523.literal: The emperor again refers to himself as 'zhen.'"
s0523.idiomatic: The emperor again refers to himself as 'zhen.'"

s0525.chinese: 二世與趙高謀曰：「朕年少，初即位，黔首未集附。
s0525.literal: The Second Emperor plotted with Zhao Gao, saying: "I am young and have just ascended the throne; the black-headed people have not yet gathered and submitted.
s0525.idiomatic: The Second Emperor plotted with Zhao Gao, saying: "I am young and have just ascended the throne; the black-headed people have not yet gathered and submitted.

s0526.chinese: 先帝巡行郡縣，以示彊，威服海內。
s0526.literal: The former emperor toured the commanderies and counties to show strength and awe all within the seas.
s0526.idiomatic: The former emperor toured the commanderies and counties to show strength and awe all within the seas.

s0527.chinese: 今晏然不巡行，即見弱，毋以臣畜天下。」
s0527.literal: Now if I peacefully do not make tours, I will appear weak and will not be able to rule all under Heaven as a minister."
s0527.idiomatic: Now if I peacefully do not make tours, I will appear weak and will not be able to rule all under Heaven as a minister."

s0528.chinese: 春，二世東行郡縣，李斯從。
s0528.literal: In spring, the Second Emperor traveled east through the commanderies and counties; Li Si accompanied him.
s0528.idiomatic: In spring, the Second Emperor traveled east through the commanderies and counties; Li Si accompanied him.

s0529.chinese: 到碣石，并海，南至會稽，而盡刻始皇所立刻石，石旁著大臣從者名，以章先帝成功盛德焉：
s0529.literal: Reaching Jieshi and going along the sea, south to Kuaiji, he had inscriptions carved on all the stone monuments the First Emperor had erected; beside the stones he added the names of the great ministers who accompanied him, to proclaim the former emperor's accomplished achievements and splendid virtue:
s0529.idiomatic: Reaching Jieshi and going along the sea, south to Kuaiji, he had inscriptions carved on all the stone monuments the First Emperor had erected; beside the stones he added the names of the great ministers who accompanied him, to proclaim the former emperor's accomplished achievements and splendid virtue:

s0530.chinese: 皇帝曰：「金石刻盡始皇帝所為也。
s0530.literal: The Emperor said: "The inscriptions on metal and stone were all done by the First Emperor.
s0530.idiomatic: The Emperor said: "The inscriptions on metal and stone were all done by the First Emperor.

s0531.chinese: 今襲號而金石刻辭不稱始皇帝，其於久遠也如後嗣為之者，不稱成功盛德。」
s0531.literal: Now I have inherited the title, but if the inscriptions on metal and stone do not mention the First Emperor, in the distant future it will seem as if later successors did them, not proclaiming his accomplished achievements and splendid virtue."
s0531.idiomatic: Now I have inherited the title, but if the inscriptions on metal and stone do not mention the First Emperor, in the distant future it will seem as if later successors did them, not proclaiming his accomplished achievements and splendid virtue."

s0532.chinese: 丞相臣斯、臣去疾、御史大夫臣德昧死言：「臣請具刻詔書刻石，因明白矣。
s0532.literal: Prime Minister and your servant Si, Minister Quji, Grand Censor and your servant De at risk of death say: "We your servants request to completely carve the decree document on the stone inscriptions, thereby making it clear.
s0532.idiomatic: Prime Minister and your servant Si, Minister Quji, Grand Censor and your servant De at risk of death say: "We your servants request to completely carve the decree document on the stone inscriptions, thereby making it clear.

s0533.literal: We your servants at risk of death request this."
s0533.idiomatic: We your servants at risk of death request this."

s0536.literal: He then went to Liaodong and returned.
s0536.idiomatic: He then went to Liaodong and returned.

s0537.chinese: 於是二世乃遵用趙高，申法令。
s0537.literal: Thereupon the Second Emperor followed and employed Zhao Gao, tightening laws and decrees.
s0537.idiomatic: Thereupon the Second Emperor followed and employed Zhao Gao, tightening laws and decrees.

s0538.chinese: 乃陰與趙高謀曰：「大臣不服，官吏尚彊，及諸公子必與我爭，為之柰何？」
s0538.literal: He then secretly plotted with Zhao Gao, saying: "The great ministers do not submit, officials are still strong, and the various princes will surely contend with me; what should I do about this?"
s0538.idiomatic: He then secretly plotted with Zhao Gao, saying: "The great ministers do not submit, officials are still strong, and the various princes will surely contend with me; what should I do about this?"

s0539.chinese: 高曰：「臣固願言而未敢也。
s0539.literal: Gao said: "I have long wished to speak but have not dared.
s0539.idiomatic: Gao said: "I have long wished to speak but have not dared.

s0540.chinese: 先帝之大臣，皆天下累世名貴人也，積功勞世以相傳久矣。
s0540.literal: The former emperor's great ministers are all people from families renowned and noble for generations throughout the land, with accumulated achievements and service transmitted from generation to generation for a long time.
s0540.idiomatic: The former emperor's great ministers are all people from families renowned and noble for generations throughout the land, with accumulated achievements and service transmitted from generation to generation for a long time.

s0541.chinese: 今高素小賤，陛下幸稱舉，令在上位，管中事。
s0541.literal: Now I, Gao, am of lowly origin; Your Majesty graciously promoted me, placing me in a high position, managing internal affairs.
s0541.idiomatic: Now I, Gao, am of lowly origin; Your Majesty graciously promoted me, placing me in a high position, managing internal affairs.

s0542.chinese: 大臣鞅鞅，特以貌從臣，其心實不服。
s0542.literal: The great ministers are resentful and discontent, only outwardly following me as minister; in their hearts they truly do not submit.
s0542.idiomatic: The great ministers are resentful and discontent, only outwardly following me as minister; in their hearts they truly do not submit.

s0543.chinese: 今上出，不因此時案郡縣守尉有罪者誅之，上以振威天下，下以除去上生平所不可者。
s0543.literal: Now that the superior has gone out, if you do not use this time to investigate commandery and county governors and commandants with crimes and execute them, above you can demonstrate your awesome power to all under Heaven, below you can eliminate those from the superior's life whom you cannot tolerate.
s0543.idiomatic: Now that the superior has gone out, if you do not use this time to investigate commandery and county governors and commandants with crimes and execute them, above you can demonstrate your awesome power to all under Heaven, below you can eliminate those from the superior's life whom you cannot tolerate.

s0544.chinese: 今時不師文而決於武力，願陛下遂從時毋疑，即群臣不及謀。
s0544.literal: Now is not the time to model on civil culture but to decide by martial force; I hope Your Majesty will follow the times without hesitation, and the assembled ministers will not have time to plot.
s0544.idiomatic: Now is not the time to model on civil culture but to decide by martial force; I hope Your Majesty will follow the times without hesitation, and the assembled ministers will not have time to plot.

s0545.chinese: 明主收舉餘民，賤者貴之，貧者富之，遠者近之，則上下集而國安矣。」
s0545.literal: If a brilliant lord gathers and elevates the remaining people, ennobles the base, enriches the poor, draws near the distant, then above and below will unite and the state will be secure."
s0545.idiomatic: If a brilliant lord gathers and elevates the remaining people, ennobles the base, enriches the poor, draws near the distant, then above and below will unite and the state will be secure."

s0547.chinese: 乃行誅大臣及諸公子，以罪過連逮少近官三郎，無得立者，而六公子戮死於杜。
s0547.literal: He then executed great ministers and various princes; due to collective punishment for crimes, arrests reached junior palace officials of the three ranks of attendants, none could be installed, and six princes were executed at Du.
s0547.idiomatic: He then executed great ministers and various princes; due to collective punishment for crimes, arrests reached junior palace officials of the three ranks of attendants, none could be installed, and six princes were executed at Du.

s0548.chinese: 公子將閭昆弟三人囚於內宮，議其罪獨後。
s0548.literal: Prince Jianglü and his two brothers were imprisoned in the inner palace and their crimes were to be deliberated later.
s0548.idiomatic: Prince Jianglü and his two brothers were imprisoned in the inner palace and their crimes were to be deliberated later.

s0549.chinese: 二世使使令將閭曰：「公子不臣，罪當死，吏致法焉。」
s0549.literal: The Second Emperor sent an envoy to order Jianglü: "Prince, you have been disloyal; your crime merits death; officials will apply the law."
s0549.idiomatic: The Second Emperor sent an envoy to order Jianglü: "Prince, you have been disloyal; your crime merits death; officials will apply the law."

s0550.chinese: 將閭曰：「闕廷之禮，吾未嘗敢不從賓贊也；
s0550.literal: Jianglü said: "In court rituals, I have never dared not follow protocol as a guest;
s0550.idiomatic: Jianglü said: "In court rituals, I have never dared not follow protocol as a guest;

s0551.chinese: 廊廟之位，吾未嘗敢失節也；
s0551.literal: in halls and temples, I have never dared lose propriety;
s0551.idiomatic: in halls and temples, I have never dared lose propriety;

s0552.chinese: 受命應對，吾未嘗敢失辭也。
s0552.literal: in receiving commands and responding to them, I have never dared speak improperly.
s0552.idiomatic: in receiving commands and responding to them, I have never dared speak improperly.

s0554.literal: I wish to hear my crime before dying."
s0554.idiomatic: I wish to hear my crime before dying."

s0555.chinese: 使者曰：「臣不得與謀，奉書從事。」
s0555.literal: The envoy said: "I cannot discuss the plot; I am only carrying out the document."
s0555.idiomatic: The envoy said: "I cannot discuss the plot; I am only carrying out the document."

s0556.chinese: 將閭乃仰天大呼天者三，曰：「天乎！
s0556.literal: Jianglü then looked up to Heaven and cried out three times, saying: "Heaven!
s0556.idiomatic: Jianglü then looked up to Heaven and cried out three times, saying: "Heaven!

s0558.chinese: 昆弟三人皆流涕拔劍自殺。
s0558.literal: The three brothers all shed tears, drew their swords, and committed suicide.
s0558.idiomatic: The three brothers all shed tears, drew their swords, and committed suicide.

s0559.literal: The royal clan was alarmed and fearful.
s0559.idiomatic: The royal clan was alarmed and fearful.

s0560.chinese: 群臣諫者以為誹謗，大吏持祿取容，黔首振恐。
s0560.literal: Ministers who remonstrated were considered slanderous; great officials clung to salaries and sought favor; the black-headed people were alarmed and fearful.
s0560.idiomatic: Ministers who remonstrated were considered slanderous; great officials clung to salaries and sought favor; the black-headed people were alarmed and fearful.

s0561.chinese: 四月，二世還至咸陽，曰：「先帝為咸陽朝廷小，故營阿房宮為室堂。
s0561.literal: In the fourth month, the Second Emperor returned to Xianyang and said: "The former emperor considered the Xianyang court too small, so he built Epang Palace as halls.
s0561.idiomatic: In the fourth month, the Second Emperor returned to Xianyang and said: "The former emperor considered the Xianyang court too small, so he built Epang Palace as halls.

s0562.chinese: 未就，會上崩，罷其作者，復土酈山。
s0562.literal: It was not yet completed when the emperor died; the workers were dismissed and returned to bury at Lishan.
s0562.idiomatic: It was not yet completed when the emperor died; the workers were dismissed and returned to bury at Lishan.

s0563.chinese: 酈山事大畢，今釋阿房宮弗就，則是章先帝舉事過也。」
s0563.literal: The Lishan project is now greatly completed; if we now abandon Epang Palace and do not complete it, this would proclaim that the former emperor's undertaking was an error."
s0563.idiomatic: The Lishan project is now greatly completed; if we now abandon Epang Palace and do not complete it, this would proclaim that the former emperor's undertaking was an error."

s0564.literal: He resumed work on Epang Palace.
s0564.idiomatic: He resumed work on Epang Palace.

s0565.literal: Externally he pacified the four barbarians, following the First Emperor's plans.
s0565.idiomatic: Externally he pacified the four barbarians, following the First Emperor's plans.

s0566.chinese: 盡徵其材士五萬人為屯衛咸陽，令教射狗馬禽獸。
s0566.literal: He mobilized all their skilled warriors, fifty thousand men, to serve as garrison guards at Xianyang, ordering them to practice shooting at dogs, horses, and wild beasts.
s0566.idiomatic: He mobilized all their skilled warriors, fifty thousand men, to serve as garrison guards at Xianyang, ordering them to practice shooting at dogs, horses, and wild beasts.

s0567.chinese: 當食者多，度不足，下調郡縣轉輸菽粟芻稿，皆令自齎糧食，咸陽三百里內不得食其穀。
s0567.literal: Those who needed to be fed were many; calculating it was insufficient, he ordered commanderies and counties to transport beans, grain, fodder, and hay, all requiring them to bring their own provisions; within three hundred li of Xianyang they could not eat their own grain.
s0567.idiomatic: Those who needed to be fed were many; calculating it was insufficient, he ordered commanderies and counties to transport beans, grain, fodder, and hay, all requiring them to bring their own provisions; within three hundred li of Xianyang they could not eat their own grain.

s0568.literal: The application of law became increasingly severe and harsh.
s0568.idiomatic: The application of law became increasingly severe and harsh.

s0569.chinese: 七月，戍卒陳勝等反故荊地，為「張楚」。
s0569.literal: In the seventh month, garrison soldiers Chen Sheng and others rebelled in the former Jing territory, calling themselves 'Zhang Chu.'
s0569.idiomatic: In the seventh month, garrison soldiers Chen Sheng and others rebelled in the former Jing territory, calling themselves 'Zhang Chu.'

s0570.chinese: 勝自立為楚王，居陳，遣諸將徇地。
s0570.literal: Sheng proclaimed himself King of Chu, resided at Chen, and sent various generals to seize territory.
s0570.idiomatic: Sheng proclaimed himself King of Chu, resided at Chen, and sent various generals to seize territory.

s0571.chinese: 山東郡縣少年苦秦吏，皆殺其守尉令丞反，以應陳涉，相立為侯王，合從西鄉，名為伐秦，不可勝數也。
s0571.literal: Young men in Shandong commanderies and counties, suffering under Qin officials, all killed their governors, commandants, magistrates, and assistants and rebelled to respond to Chen She; they mutually proclaimed themselves lords and kings, formed vertical alliances facing west, claiming to attack Qin; their numbers were countless.
s0571.idiomatic: Young men in Shandong commanderies and counties, suffering under Qin officials, all killed their governors, commandants, magistrates, and assistants and rebelled to respond to Chen She; they mutually proclaimed themselves lords and kings, formed vertical alliances facing west, claiming to attack Qin; their numbers were countless.

s0572.chinese: 謁者使東方來，以反者聞二世。
s0572.literal: An emissary sent to the east returned and reported the rebels to the Second Emperor.
s0572.idiomatic: An emissary sent to the east returned and reported the rebels to the Second Emperor.

s0573.literal: The Second Emperor was angry and imprisoned the official.
s0573.idiomatic: The Second Emperor was angry and imprisoned the official.

s0574.chinese: 後使者至，上問，對曰：「群盜，郡守尉方逐捕，今盡得，不足憂。」
s0574.literal: When later envoys arrived, the emperor asked and they replied: "They are bandits; the commandery governors and commandants are pursuing and capturing them; now all have been caught; this is not worth worrying about."
s0574.idiomatic: When later envoys arrived, the emperor asked and they replied: "They are bandits; the commandery governors and commandants are pursuing and capturing them; now all have been caught; this is not worth worrying about."

s0576.chinese: 武臣自立為趙王，魏咎為魏王，田儋為齊王。
s0576.literal: Wu Chen proclaimed himself King of Zhao, Wei Jiu as King of Wei, Tian Dan as King of Qi.
s0576.idiomatic: Wu Chen proclaimed himself King of Zhao, Wei Jiu as King of Wei, Tian Dan as King of Qi.

s0577.literal: The Duke of Pei rose at Pei.
s0577.idiomatic: The Duke of Pei rose at Pei.

s0578.literal: Xiang Liang raised troops in Kuaiji Commandery.
s0578.idiomatic: Xiang Liang raised troops in Kuaiji Commandery.

s0579.chinese: 二年冬，陳涉所遣周章等將西至戲，兵數十萬。
s0579.literal: In the winter of the second year, Zhou Zhang and others sent by Chen She led their forces west to Xi; their troops numbered in the hundreds of thousands.
s0579.idiomatic: In the winter of the second year, Zhou Zhang and others sent by Chen She led their forces west to Xi; their troops numbered in the hundreds of thousands.

s0580.chinese: 二世大驚，與群臣謀曰：「柰何？」
s0580.literal: The Second Emperor was greatly alarmed and plotted with the assembled ministers, saying: "What should be done?"
s0580.idiomatic: The Second Emperor was greatly alarmed and plotted with the assembled ministers, saying: "What should be done?"

s0581.chinese: 少府章邯曰：「盜已至，眾彊，今發近縣不及矣。
s0581.literal: Junior Commandant Zhang Han said: "The bandits have already arrived in great strength; mobilizing nearby counties will not be in time.
s0581.idiomatic: Junior Commandant Zhang Han said: "The bandits have already arrived in great strength; mobilizing nearby counties will not be in time.

s0582.chinese: 酈山徒多，請赦之，授兵以擊之。」
s0582.literal: The Lishan convicts are numerous; I request to pardon them, give them weapons, and use them to attack."
s0582.idiomatic: The Lishan convicts are numerous; I request to pardon them, give them weapons, and use them to attack."

s0583.chinese: 二世乃大赦天下，使章邯將，擊破周章軍而走，遂殺章曹陽。
s0583.literal: The Second Emperor then granted a great amnesty throughout the land and sent Zhang Han to command; he defeated Zhou Zhang's army which fled, then killed Zhang at Caoyang.
s0583.idiomatic: The Second Emperor then granted a great amnesty throughout the land and sent Zhang Han to command; he defeated Zhou Zhang's army which fled, then killed Zhang at Caoyang.

s0584.chinese: 二世益遣長史司馬欣、董翳佐章邯擊盜，殺陳勝城父，破項梁定陶，滅魏咎臨濟。
s0584.literal: The Second Emperor further sent Chief Clerk Sima Xin and Dong Yi to assist Zhang Han in attacking the bandits; they killed Chen Sheng at Chengfu, defeated Xiang Liang at Dingtao, and destroyed Wei Jiu at Linji.
s0584.idiomatic: The Second Emperor further sent Chief Clerk Sima Xin and Dong Yi to assist Zhang Han in attacking the bandits; they killed Chen Sheng at Chengfu, defeated Xiang Liang at Dingtao, and destroyed Wei Jiu at Linji.

s0585.chinese: 楚地盜名將已死，章邯乃北渡河，擊趙王歇等於鉅鹿。
s0585.literal: The bandit leaders of the Chu territory having all died, Zhang Han then crossed the Yellow River northward and attacked King Xie of Zhao and others at Julu.
s0585.idiomatic: The bandit leaders of the Chu territory having all died, Zhang Han then crossed the Yellow River northward and attacked King Xie of Zhao and others at Julu.

s0586.chinese: 趙高說二世曰：「先帝臨制天下久，故群臣不敢為非，進邪說。
s0586.literal: Zhao Gao persuaded the Second Emperor, saying: "The former emperor controlled all under Heaven for a long time, so the assembled ministers dared not act improperly or advance evil proposals.
s0586.idiomatic: Zhao Gao persuaded the Second Emperor, saying: "The former emperor controlled all under Heaven for a long time, so the assembled ministers dared not act improperly or advance evil proposals.

s0587.chinese: 今陛下富於春秋，初即位，柰何與公卿廷決事？
s0587.literal: Now Your Majesty is in the prime of youth and has just ascended the throne; how can you decide matters together with dukes and ministers at court?
s0587.idiomatic: Now Your Majesty is in the prime of youth and has just ascended the throne; how can you decide matters together with dukes and ministers at court?

s0588.literal: If affairs have errors, this shows the assembled ministers your shortcomings.
s0588.idiomatic: If affairs have errors, this shows the assembled ministers your shortcomings.

s0589.literal: The Son of Heaven is called 'zhen'; naturally his voice is not heard."
s0589.idiomatic: The Son of Heaven is called 'zhen'; naturally his voice is not heard."

s0590.chinese: 於是二世常居禁中，與高決諸事。
s0590.literal: Thereupon the Second Emperor constantly remained within the forbidden palace, deciding all affairs with Gao.
s0590.idiomatic: Thereupon the Second Emperor constantly remained within the forbidden palace, deciding all affairs with Gao.

s0591.chinese: 其後公卿希得朝見，盜賊益多，而關中卒發東擊盜者毋已。
s0591.literal: Thereafter dukes and ministers rarely obtained audience; bandits and thieves increased further, while troops from Guanzhong mobilized eastward to attack bandits without end.
s0591.idiomatic: Thereafter dukes and ministers rarely obtained audience; bandits and thieves increased further, while troops from Guanzhong mobilized eastward to attack bandits without end.

s0592.chinese: 右丞相去疾、左丞相斯、將軍馮劫進諫曰：「關東群盜并起，秦發兵誅擊，所殺亡甚眾，然猶不止。
s0592.literal: Right Prime Minister Quji, Left Prime Minister Si, and General Feng Jie came forward to remonstrate, saying: "Bandits east of the passes have risen together; Qin mobilizes troops to execute and attack them; those killed and lost are very numerous, yet still they do not stop.
s0592.idiomatic: Right Prime Minister Quji, Left Prime Minister Si, and General Feng Jie came forward to remonstrate, saying: "Bandits east of the passes have risen together; Qin mobilizes troops to execute and attack them; those killed and lost are very numerous, yet still they do not stop.

s0593.chinese: 盜多，皆以戌漕轉作事苦，賦稅大也。
s0593.literal: Bandits are numerous all because garrison service, grain transport, and construction work are bitter, and taxes are heavy.
s0593.idiomatic: Bandits are numerous all because garrison service, grain transport, and construction work are bitter, and taxes are heavy.

s0594.chinese: 請且止阿房宮作者，減省四邊戍轉。」
s0594.literal: We request temporarily halting work on Epang Palace and reducing border garrison transport to the four frontiers."
s0594.idiomatic: We request temporarily halting work on Epang Palace and reducing border garrison transport to the four frontiers."

s0595.chinese: 二世曰：「吾聞之韓子曰：『堯舜采椽不刮，茅茨不翦，飯土塯，啜土形，雖監門之養，不觳於此。
s0595.literal: The Second Emperor said: "I have heard from Hanzi who said: 'Yao and Shun's rafters were not scraped, thatched roofs not trimmed, they ate from earthen bowls and drank from earthen vessels; even the sustenance of a gate guard was no worse than this.
s0595.idiomatic: The Second Emperor said: "I have heard from Hanzi who said: 'Yao and Shun's rafters were not scraped, thatched roofs not trimmed, they ate from earthen bowls and drank from earthen vessels; even the sustenance of a gate guard was no worse than this.

s0596.chinese: 禹鑿龍門，通大夏，決河亭水，放之海，身自持筑臿，脛毋毛，臣虜之勞不烈於此矣。』
s0596.literal: Yu dug through Dragon Gate, opened the Great Xia, broke through river pavilions and waters, releasing them to the sea, personally holding the rammer and spade, his shins without hair; the labor of slaves and servants was not more severe than this.'
s0596.idiomatic: Yu dug through Dragon Gate, opened the Great Xia, broke through river pavilions and waters, releasing them to the sea, personally holding the rammer and spade, his shins without hair; the labor of slaves and servants was not more severe than this.'

s0597.chinese: 凡所為貴有天下者，得肆意極欲，主重明法，下不敢為非，以制御海內矣。
s0597.literal: The reason it is noble to possess all under Heaven is to be able to indulge one's will to the utmost; the lord emphasizes and clarifies laws, so those below dare not act improperly, thereby controlling all within the seas.
s0597.idiomatic: The reason it is noble to possess all under Heaven is to be able to indulge one's will to the utmost; the lord emphasizes and clarifies laws, so those below dare not act improperly, thereby controlling all within the seas.

s0598.chinese: 夫虞、夏之主，貴為天子，親處窮苦之實，以徇百姓，尚何於法？
s0598.literal: The lords of Yu and Xia, though noble as Sons of Heaven, personally dwelt in actual poverty and hardship to serve the hundred clans; what need did they have for laws and standards?
s0598.idiomatic: The lords of Yu and Xia, though noble as Sons of Heaven, personally dwelt in actual poverty and hardship to serve the hundred clans; what need did they have for laws and standards?

s0599.chinese: 朕尊萬乘，毋其實，吾欲造千乘之駕，萬乘之屬，充吾號名。
s0599.literal: I am honored with ten thousand chariots without their reality; I want to create the carriages of a thousand chariots and the attributes of ten thousand chariots to fulfill my title and name.
s0599.idiomatic: I am honored with ten thousand chariots without their reality; I want to create the carriages of a thousand chariots and the attributes of ten thousand chariots to fulfill my title and name.

s0600.chinese: 且先帝起諸侯，兼天下，天下已定，外攘四夷以安邊竟，作宮室以章得意，而君觀先帝功業有緒。
s0600.literal: Moreover, the former emperor rose from among the feudal lords and unified all under Heaven; all under Heaven having been settled, externally he drove out the four barbarians to secure the borders, built palaces to proclaim his satisfaction, and you observe the former emperor's achievements and enterprises having order.
s0600.idiomatic: Moreover, the former emperor rose from among the feudal lords and unified all under Heaven; all under Heaven having been settled, externally he drove out the four barbarians to secure the borders, built palaces to proclaim his satisfaction, and you observe the former emperor's achievements and enterprises having order.

s0601.chinese: 今朕即位二年之閒，群盜并起，君不能禁，又欲罷先帝之所為，是上毋以報先帝，次不為朕盡忠力，何以在位？」
s0601.literal: Now in the two years since I ascended the throne, bandits have risen together; you cannot prohibit them, and moreover you want to stop what the former emperor was doing; above this does not repay the former emperor, below you do not exhaust loyal effort for me; why do you hold positions?"
s0601.idiomatic: Now in the two years since I ascended the throne, bandits have risen together; you cannot prohibit them, and moreover you want to stop what the former emperor was doing; above this does not repay the former emperor, below you do not exhaust loyal effort for me; why do you hold positions?"

s0602.chinese: 下去疾、斯、劫吏，案責他罪。
s0602.literal: He handed Quji, Si, and Jie over to officials, who investigated and charged them with other crimes.
s0602.idiomatic: He handed Quji, Si, and Jie over to officials, who investigated and charged them with other crimes.

s0603.literal: Quji and Jie said: "Generals and prime ministers should not be humiliated."
s0603.idiomatic: Quji and Jie said: "Generals and prime ministers should not be humiliated."

s0605.literal: Si was finally imprisoned and subjected to the five punishments.
s0605.idiomatic: Si was finally imprisoned and subjected to the five punishments.

s0606.chinese: 三年，章邯等將其卒圍鉅鹿，楚上將軍項羽將楚卒往救鉅鹿。
s0606.literal: In the third year, Zhang Han and others led their troops to besiege Julu; the Chu supreme general Xiang Yu led Chu troops to rescue Julu.
s0606.idiomatic: In the third year, Zhang Han and others led their troops to besiege Julu; the Chu supreme general Xiang Yu led Chu troops to rescue Julu.

s0607.chinese: 冬，趙高為丞相，竟案李斯殺之。
s0607.literal: In winter, Zhao Gao became prime minister and finally investigated Li Si and killed him.
s0607.idiomatic: In winter, Zhao Gao became prime minister and finally investigated Li Si and killed him.

s0608.chinese: 夏，章邯等戰數卻，二世使人讓邯，邯恐，使長史欣請事。
s0608.literal: In summer, Zhang Han and others fought several defeats; the Second Emperor sent someone to reproach Han; Han was afraid and sent Chief Clerk Xin to request instructions.
s0608.idiomatic: In summer, Zhang Han and others fought several defeats; the Second Emperor sent someone to reproach Han; Han was afraid and sent Chief Clerk Xin to request instructions.

s0609.literal: Zhao Gao refused to see him and moreover did not trust him.
s0609.idiomatic: Zhao Gao refused to see him and moreover did not trust him.

s0610.chinese: 欣恐，亡去，高使人捕追不及。
s0610.literal: Xin was afraid and fled; Gao sent people to pursue and arrest him but did not catch him.
s0610.idiomatic: Xin was afraid and fled; Gao sent people to pursue and arrest him but did not catch him.

s0611.chinese: 欣見邯曰：「趙高用事於中，將軍有功亦誅，無功亦誅。」
s0611.literal: Xin met with Han and said: "Zhao Gao handles affairs internally; whether you, general, have achievements or not, you will be executed."
s0611.idiomatic: Xin met with Han and said: "Zhao Gao handles affairs internally; whether you, general, have achievements or not, you will be executed."

s0612.chinese: 項羽急擊秦軍，虜王離，邯等遂以兵降諸侯。
s0612.literal: Xiang Yu urgently attacked the Qin army, captured Wang Li; Han and others then surrendered with their troops to the feudal lords.
s0612.idiomatic: Xiang Yu urgently attacked the Qin army, captured Wang Li; Han and others then surrendered with their troops to the feudal lords.

s0613.chinese: 八月己亥，趙高欲為亂，恐群臣不聽，乃先設驗，持鹿獻於二世，曰：「馬也。」
s0613.literal: On the jihai day of the eighth month, Zhao Gao wanted to create disorder but feared the assembled ministers would not obey, so he first set up a test: he presented a deer to the Second Emperor and said: "It is a horse."
s0613.idiomatic: On the jihai day of the eighth month, Zhao Gao wanted to create disorder but feared the assembled ministers would not obey, so he first set up a test: he presented a deer to the Second Emperor and said: "It is a horse."

s0614.literal: The Second Emperor laughed and said: "Is the prime minister mistaken?
s0614.idiomatic: The Second Emperor laughed and said: "Is the prime minister mistaken?

s0616.chinese: 問左右，左右或默，或言馬以阿順趙高。
s0616.literal: He asked those around him; some remained silent, some said horse to flatter and follow Zhao Gao.
s0616.idiomatic: He asked those around him; some remained silent, some said horse to flatter and follow Zhao Gao.

s0617.chinese: 或言鹿（者），高因陰中諸言鹿者以法。
s0617.literal: Those who said deer, Gao then secretly used the law against all who said deer.
s0617.idiomatic: Those who said deer, Gao then secretly used the law against all who said deer.

s0618.literal: Thereafter all the assembled ministers feared Gao.
s0618.idiomatic: Thereafter all the assembled ministers feared Gao.

s0619.chinese: 高前數言「關東盜毋能為也」，及項羽虜秦將王離等鉅鹿下而前，章邯等軍數卻，上書請益助，燕、趙、齊、楚、韓、魏皆立為王，自關以東，大氐盡畔秦吏應諸侯，諸侯咸率其眾西鄉。
s0619.literal: Gao had previously repeatedly said 'bandits east of the passes cannot accomplish anything,' but when Xiang Yu captured Qin general Wang Li and others below Julu and advanced, Zhang Han and others' armies suffered repeated defeats; they sent memorials requesting reinforcements; Yan, Zhao, Qi, Chu, Han, and Wei all installed themselves as kings; from the passes eastward, most had rebelled against Qin officials and responded to the feudal lords; all the feudal lords led their masses westward.
s0619.idiomatic: Gao had previously repeatedly said 'bandits east of the passes cannot accomplish anything,' but when Xiang Yu captured Qin general Wang Li and others below Julu and advanced, Zhang Han and others' armies suffered repeated defeats; they sent memorials requesting reinforcements; Yan, Zhao, Qi, Chu, Han, and Wei all installed themselves as kings; from the passes eastward, most had rebelled against Qin officials and responded to the feudal lords; all the feudal lords led their masses westward.

s0620.chinese: 沛公將數萬人已屠武關，使人私於高，高恐二世怒，誅及其身，乃謝病不朝見。
s0620.literal: The Duke of Pei, leading several tens of thousands, had already captured Wuguan and sent people privately to Gao; Gao feared the Second Emperor would be angry and punishment would reach him personally, so he feigned illness and did not come to court.
s0620.idiomatic: The Duke of Pei, leading several tens of thousands, had already captured Wuguan and sent people privately to Gao; Gao feared the Second Emperor would be angry and punishment would reach him personally, so he feigned illness and did not come to court.

s0621.chinese: 二世夢白虎齧其左驂馬，殺之，心不樂，怪問占夢。
s0621.literal: The Second Emperor dreamed that a white tiger bit off his left trace horse and killed it; his heart was uneasy, and he strangely inquired about dream interpretation.
s0621.idiomatic: The Second Emperor dreamed that a white tiger bit off his left trace horse and killed it; his heart was uneasy, and he strangely inquired about dream interpretation.

s0622.literal: The divination said: "The Jing River is causing calamity."
s0622.idiomatic: The divination said: "The Jing River is causing calamity."

s0623.chinese: 二世乃齋於望夷宮，欲祠涇，沈四白馬。
s0623.literal: The Second Emperor then fasted at Wangyi Palace, wishing to sacrifice to the Jing River, and sank four white horses.
s0623.idiomatic: The Second Emperor then fasted at Wangyi Palace, wishing to sacrifice to the Jing River, and sank four white horses.

s0624.literal: He sent an envoy to reproach Gao about bandit matters.
s0624.idiomatic: He sent an envoy to reproach Gao about bandit matters.

s0625.chinese: 高懼，乃陰與其婿咸陽令閻樂、其弟趙成謀曰：「上不聽諫，今事急，欲歸禍於吾宗。
s0625.literal: Gao was afraid, so he secretly plotted with his son-in-law Yan Le, the Xianyang magistrate, and his younger brother Zhao Cheng, saying: "The emperor does not listen to remonstrances; now affairs are urgent and he wants to direct blame to my clan.
s0625.idiomatic: Gao was afraid, so he secretly plotted with his son-in-law Yan Le, the Xianyang magistrate, and his younger brother Zhao Cheng, saying: "The emperor does not listen to remonstrances; now affairs are urgent and he wants to direct blame to my clan.

s0626.chinese: 吾欲易置上，更立公子嬰。
s0626.literal: I want to replace the emperor and install Prince Ying.
s0626.idiomatic: I want to replace the emperor and install Prince Ying.

s0627.chinese: 子嬰仁儉，百姓皆載其言。」
s0627.literal: Prince Ying is benevolent and frugal; the hundred clans all support his words."
s0627.idiomatic: Prince Ying is benevolent and frugal; the hundred clans all support his words."

s0628.chinese: 使郎中令為內應，詐為有大賊，令樂召吏發卒，追劫樂母置高舍。
s0628.literal: He had the Palace Attendant Commander serve as internal support, falsely claiming there were major bandits, had Le summon officials and mobilize troops, forcibly kidnapped Le's mother and placed her at Gao's residence.
s0628.idiomatic: He had the Palace Attendant Commander serve as internal support, falsely claiming there were major bandits, had Le summon officials and mobilize troops, forcibly kidnapped Le's mother and placed her at Gao's residence.

s0629.chinese: 遣樂將吏卒千餘人至望夷宮殿門，縛衛令仆射，曰：「賊入此，何不止？」
s0629.literal: He sent Le to lead officials and troops, over a thousand men, to the Wangyi Palace gate, bound the Guard Commander and Chief Clerk, and said: "Bandits have entered here; why did you not stop them?"
s0629.idiomatic: He sent Le to lead officials and troops, over a thousand men, to the Wangyi Palace gate, bound the Guard Commander and Chief Clerk, and said: "Bandits have entered here; why did you not stop them?"

s0630.chinese: 衛令曰：「周廬設卒甚謹，安得賊敢入宮？」
s0630.literal: The Guard Commander said: "The surrounding guardhouses and deployed troops are very vigilant; how could bandits dare enter the palace?"
s0630.idiomatic: The Guard Commander said: "The surrounding guardhouses and deployed troops are very vigilant; how could bandits dare enter the palace?"

s0631.chinese: 樂遂斬衛令，直將吏入，行射，郎宦者大驚，或走或格，格者輒死，死者數十人。
s0631.literal: Le then beheaded the Guard Commander, directly led officials in, and shot as they went; palace attendants and eunuchs were greatly frightened, some fled, some resisted; those who resisted were immediately killed; dozens died.
s0631.idiomatic: Le then beheaded the Guard Commander, directly led officials in, and shot as they went; palace attendants and eunuchs were greatly frightened, some fled, some resisted; those who resisted were immediately killed; dozens died.

s0632.chinese: 郎中令與樂俱入，射上幄坐幃。
s0632.literal: The Palace Attendant Commander and Le entered together and shot at the emperor's curtained seat.
s0632.idiomatic: The Palace Attendant Commander and Le entered together and shot at the emperor's curtained seat.

s0633.chinese: 二世怒，召左右，左右皆惶擾不鬬。
s0633.literal: The Second Emperor was angry and summoned those around him, but all were panicked and confused and did not fight.
s0633.idiomatic: The Second Emperor was angry and summoned those around him, but all were panicked and confused and did not fight.

s0634.chinese: 旁有宦者一人，侍不敢去。
s0634.literal: Nearby was one eunuch who attended and did not dare leave.
s0634.idiomatic: Nearby was one eunuch who attended and did not dare leave.

s0635.chinese: 二世入內，謂曰：「公何不蚤告我？
s0635.literal: The Second Emperor entered the inner chambers and said to him: "Why did you not warn me earlier?
s0635.idiomatic: The Second Emperor entered the inner chambers and said to him: "Why did you not warn me earlier?

s0636.literal: Now it has come to this!"
s0636.idiomatic: Now it has come to this!"

s0637.chinese: 宦者曰：「臣不敢言，故得全。
s0637.literal: The eunuch said: "I did not dare speak, therefore I survived.
s0637.idiomatic: The eunuch said: "I did not dare speak, therefore I survived.

s0638.chinese: 使臣蚤言，皆已誅，安得至今？」
s0638.literal: Had I spoken early, I would already have been executed; how would I have reached today?"
s0638.idiomatic: Had I spoken early, I would already have been executed; how would I have reached today?"

s0639.chinese: 閻樂前即二世數曰：「足下驕恣，誅殺無道，天下共畔足下，足下其自為計。」
s0639.literal: Yan Le came forward to the Second Emperor and enumerated his crimes: "You have been arrogant and willful, executing and killing without proper cause; all under Heaven has rebelled against you together; you should make your own decision."
s0639.idiomatic: Yan Le came forward to the Second Emperor and enumerated his crimes: "You have been arrogant and willful, executing and killing without proper cause; all under Heaven has rebelled against you together; you should make your own decision."

s0640.literal: The Second Emperor said: "Can I see the prime minister?"
s0640.idiomatic: The Second Emperor said: "Can I see the prime minister?"

s0642.chinese: 二世曰：「吾願得一郡為王。」
s0642.literal: The Second Emperor said: "I wish to obtain one commandery to be king."
s0642.idiomatic: The Second Emperor said: "I wish to obtain one commandery to be king."

s0644.literal: He said again: "I wish to be a marquis of ten thousand households."
s0644.idiomatic: He said again: "I wish to be a marquis of ten thousand households."

s0646.chinese: 曰：「願與妻子為黔首，比諸公子。」
s0646.literal: He said: "I wish to be a commoner with my wife and children, like the other princes."
s0646.idiomatic: He said: "I wish to be a commoner with my wife and children, like the other princes."

s0647.chinese: 閻樂曰：「臣受命於丞相，為天下誅足下，足下雖多言，臣不敢報。」
s0647.literal: Yan Le said: "I received orders from the prime minister to execute you on behalf of all under Heaven; though you speak much, I dare not relay it."
s0647.idiomatic: Yan Le said: "I received orders from the prime minister to execute you on behalf of all under Heaven; though you speak much, I dare not relay it."

s0648.literal: He signaled his troops to advance.
s0648.idiomatic: He signaled his troops to advance.

s0650.chinese: 閻樂歸報趙高，趙高乃悉召諸大臣公子，告以誅二世之狀。
s0650.literal: Yan Le returned and reported to Zhao Gao; Zhao Gao then summoned all the great ministers and princes and informed them of the circumstances of executing the Second Emperor.
s0650.idiomatic: Yan Le returned and reported to Zhao Gao; Zhao Gao then summoned all the great ministers and princes and informed them of the circumstances of executing the Second Emperor.

s0651.chinese: 曰：「秦故王國，始皇君天下，故稱帝。
s0651.literal: He said: "Qin was formerly a royal state; when the First Emperor ruled all under Heaven, he was therefore called Emperor.
s0651.idiomatic: He said: "Qin was formerly a royal state; when the First Emperor ruled all under Heaven, he was therefore called Emperor.

s0652.chinese: 今六國復自立，秦地益小，乃以空名為帝，不可。
s0652.literal: Now the six states have again independently established themselves; Qin's territory has become smaller; to use the empty title of Emperor is not acceptable.
s0652.idiomatic: Now the six states have again independently established themselves; Qin's territory has become smaller; to use the empty title of Emperor is not acceptable.

s0653.literal: It would be appropriate to be king as before; this is expedient."
s0653.idiomatic: It would be appropriate to be king as before; this is expedient."

s0654.chinese: 立二世之兄子公子嬰為秦王。
s0654.literal: He installed the Second Emperor's elder brother's son, Prince Ying, as King of Qin.
s0654.idiomatic: He installed the Second Emperor's elder brother's son, Prince Ying, as King of Qin.

s0655.chinese: 以黔首葬二世杜南宜春苑中。
s0655.literal: He had the black-headed people bury the Second Emperor in Yichun Garden south of Du.
s0655.idiomatic: He had the black-headed people bury the Second Emperor in Yichun Garden south of Du.

s0656.chinese: 令子嬰齋，當廟見，受王璽。
s0656.literal: He ordered Prince Ying to fast, when he should appear at the temple to receive the king's seal.
s0656.idiomatic: He ordered Prince Ying to fast, when he should appear at the temple to receive the king's seal.

s0657.chinese: 齋五日，子嬰與其子二人謀曰：「丞相高殺二世望夷宮，恐群臣誅之，乃詳以義立我。
s0657.literal: After fasting for five days, Prince Ying plotted with his two sons, saying: "Prime Minister Gao killed the Second Emperor at Wangyi Palace; fearing the assembled ministers would execute him, he pretended righteously to install me.
s0657.idiomatic: After fasting for five days, Prince Ying plotted with his two sons, saying: "Prime Minister Gao killed the Second Emperor at Wangyi Palace; fearing the assembled ministers would execute him, he pretended righteously to install me.

s0658.chinese: 我聞趙高乃與楚約，滅秦宗室而王關中。
s0658.literal: I have heard that Zhao Gao made an agreement with Chu to destroy the Qin royal clan and rule Guanzhong.
s0658.idiomatic: I have heard that Zhao Gao made an agreement with Chu to destroy the Qin royal clan and rule Guanzhong.

s0659.chinese: 今使我齋見廟，此欲因廟中殺我。
s0659.literal: Now he has me fast and appear at the temple; this is wanting to kill me in the temple.
s0659.idiomatic: Now he has me fast and appear at the temple; this is wanting to kill me in the temple.

s0660.chinese: 我稱病不行，丞相必自來，來則殺之。」
s0660.literal: I will feign illness and not go; the prime minister will surely come himself; when he comes I will kill him."
s0660.idiomatic: I will feign illness and not go; the prime minister will surely come himself; when he comes I will kill him."

s0661.chinese: 高使人請子嬰數輩，子嬰不行，高果自往，曰：「宗廟重事，王柰何不行？」
s0661.literal: Gao sent people to request Prince Ying several times; Prince Ying did not go; Gao indeed came himself and said: "Ancestral temple affairs are of great importance; why does the king not go?"
s0661.idiomatic: Gao sent people to request Prince Ying several times; Prince Ying did not go; Gao indeed came himself and said: "Ancestral temple affairs are of great importance; why does the king not go?"

s0662.chinese: 子嬰遂刺殺高於齋宮，三族高家以徇咸陽。
s0662.literal: Prince Ying then stabbed and killed Gao at the fasting palace and exterminated Gao's three clans, displaying them as a warning throughout Xianyang.
s0662.idiomatic: Prince Ying then stabbed and killed Gao at the fasting palace and exterminated Gao's three clans, displaying them as a warning throughout Xianyang.

s0663.chinese: 子嬰為秦王四十六日，楚將沛公破秦軍入武關，遂至霸上，使人約降子嬰。
s0663.literal: Prince Ying served as King of Qin for forty-six days; the Chu general Duke of Pei defeated the Qin army, entered Wuguan, and reached Beshang, sending someone to arrange Prince Ying's surrender.
s0663.idiomatic: Prince Ying served as King of Qin for forty-six days; the Chu general Duke of Pei defeated the Qin army, entered Wuguan, and reached Beshang, sending someone to arrange Prince Ying's surrender.

s0664.chinese: 子嬰即系頸以組，白馬素車，奉天子璽符，降軹道旁。
s0664.literal: Prince Ying then tied a cord around his neck, rode in a plain white chariot drawn by white horses, presented the Son of Heaven's seal and tallies, and surrendered by the side of Zhidao.
s0664.idiomatic: Prince Ying then tied a cord around his neck, rode in a plain white chariot drawn by white horses, presented the Son of Heaven's seal and tallies, and surrendered by the side of Zhidao.

s0665.chinese: 沛公遂入咸陽，封宮室府庫，還軍霸上。
s0665.literal: The Duke of Pei then entered Xianyang, sealed the palaces and treasury, and returned the army to Bashang.
s0665.idiomatic: The Duke of Pei then entered Xianyang, sealed the palaces and treasury, and returned the army to Bashang.

s0666.chinese: 居月餘，諸侯兵至，項籍為從長，殺子嬰及秦諸公子宗族。
s0666.literal: After dwelling for over a month, the feudal lords' armies arrived; Xiang Ji was the chief of the alliance and killed Prince Ying and all the Qin princes and royal clan.
s0666.idiomatic: After dwelling for over a month, the feudal lords' armies arrived; Xiang Ji was the chief of the alliance and killed Prince Ying and all the Qin princes and royal clan.

s0667.chinese: 遂屠咸陽，燒其宮室，虜其子女，收其珍寶貨財，諸侯共分之。
s0667.literal: He then massacred Xianyang, burned its palaces, captured its sons and daughters, and collected its precious treasures and wealth; the feudal lords divided them among themselves.
s0667.idiomatic: He then massacred Xianyang, burned its palaces, captured its sons and daughters, and collected its precious treasures and wealth; the feudal lords divided them among themselves.

s0668.chinese: 滅秦之後，各分其地為三，名曰雍王、塞王、翟王，號曰三秦。
s0668.literal: After destroying Qin, they each divided its territory into three, naming them King of Yong, King of Sai, and King of Di, collectively called the Three Qin.
s0668.idiomatic: After destroying Qin, they each divided its territory into three, naming them King of Yong, King of Sai, and King of Di, collectively called the Three Qin.

s0669.chinese: 項羽為西楚霸王，主命分天下王諸侯，秦竟滅矣。
s0669.literal: Xiang Yu became Hegemon-King of Western Chu, commanded and divided all under Heaven among the feudal lords as kings; Qin was finally destroyed.
s0669.idiomatic: Xiang Yu became Hegemon-King of Western Chu, commanded and divided all under Heaven among the feudal lords as kings; Qin was finally destroyed.

s0670.literal: Five years later, all under Heaven was settled under Han.
s0670.idiomatic: Five years later, all under Heaven was settled under Han.

s0671.chinese: 太史公曰：秦之先伯翳，嘗有勳於唐虞之際，受土賜姓。
s0671.literal: The Grand Historian says: Qin's ancestor Boyi once had meritorious service during the time of Tang and Yu, received land and was granted a surname.
s0671.idiomatic: The Grand Historian says: Qin's ancestor Boyi once had meritorious service during the time of Tang and Yu, received land and was granted a surname.

s0672.literal: Between Yin and Xia he became obscure and scattered.
s0672.idiomatic: Between Yin and Xia he became obscure and scattered.

s0673.chinese: 至周之衰，秦興，邑于西垂。
s0673.literal: When Zhou declined, Qin arose, establishing a town at Western Chui.
s0673.idiomatic: When Zhou declined, Qin arose, establishing a town at Western Chui.

s0674.chinese: 自繆公以來，稍蠶食諸侯，竟成始皇。
s0674.literal: From Duke Mu onward, they gradually devoured the feudal lords bit by bit, finally producing the First Emperor.
s0674.idiomatic: From Duke Mu onward, they gradually devoured the feudal lords bit by bit, finally producing the First Emperor.

s0675.chinese: 始皇自以為功過五帝，地廣三王，而羞與之侔。
s0675.literal: The First Emperor considered himself to have achievements surpassing the Five Emperors and territory broader than the Three Kings, and was ashamed to be equaled with them.
s0675.idiomatic: The First Emperor considered himself to have achievements surpassing the Five Emperors and territory broader than the Three Kings, and was ashamed to be equaled with them.

s0676.literal: How excellent was Master Jia's extended reasoning!
s0676.idiomatic: How excellent was Master Jia's extended reasoning!

s0678.chinese: 秦并兼諸侯山東三十餘郡，繕津關，據險塞，修甲兵而守之。
s0678.literal: Qin annexed the feudal lords of Shandong into over thirty commanderies, repaired ferry crossings and passes, occupied strategic passes and fortifications, and maintained armor and weapons to guard them.
s0678.idiomatic: Qin annexed the feudal lords of Shandong into over thirty commanderies, repaired ferry crossings and passes, occupied strategic passes and fortifications, and maintained armor and weapons to guard them.

s0679.chinese: 然陳涉以戍卒散亂之眾數百，奮臂大呼，不用弓戟之兵，鉏櫌白梃，望屋而食，橫行天下。
s0679.literal: Yet Chen She with a scattered and chaotic crowd of garrison soldiers numbering in the hundreds, raising his arm and shouting loudly, without using the weapons of bows and halberds, with only hoes, rakes, and white clubs, taking food wherever they saw houses, rampaged throughout the land.
s0679.idiomatic: Yet Chen She with a scattered and chaotic crowd of garrison soldiers numbering in the hundreds, raising his arm and shouting loudly, without using the weapons of bows and halberds, with only hoes, rakes, and white clubs, taking food wherever they saw houses, rampaged throughout the land.

s0680.chinese: 秦人阻險不守，關梁不闔，長戟不刺，彊弩不射。
s0680.literal: The Qin people blocked strategic passes but did not guard them; passes and bridges were not closed, long halberds did not stab, and strong crossbows did not shoot.
s0680.idiomatic: The Qin people blocked strategic passes but did not guard them; passes and bridges were not closed, long halberds did not stab, and strong crossbows did not shoot.

s0681.chinese: 楚師深入，戰於鴻門，曾無藩籬之艱。
s0681.literal: The Chu army deeply penetrated and fought at Hongmen, without encountering even the difficulty of hedges and fences.
s0681.idiomatic: The Chu army deeply penetrated and fought at Hongmen, without encountering even the difficulty of hedges and fences.

s0682.chinese: 於是山東大擾，諸侯并起，豪俊相立。
s0682.literal: Thereupon Shandong was greatly disturbed, feudal lords rose together, and heroes mutually established themselves.
s0682.idiomatic: Thereupon Shandong was greatly disturbed, feudal lords rose together, and heroes mutually established themselves.

s0683.chinese: 秦使章邯將而東征，章邯因以三軍之眾要市於外，以謀其上。
s0683.literal: Qin sent Zhang Han to command and march east; Zhang Han then used his three armies to bargain from outside to plot against his superior.
s0683.idiomatic: Qin sent Zhang Han to command and march east; Zhang Han then used his three armies to bargain from outside to plot against his superior.

s0684.chinese: 群臣之不信，可見於此矣。
s0684.literal: That the assembled ministers were not trusted can be seen from this.
s0684.idiomatic: That the assembled ministers were not trusted can be seen from this.

s0685.literal: When Prince Ying was installed, he still did not awaken.
s0685.idiomatic: When Prince Ying was installed, he still did not awaken.

s0686.chinese: 藉使子嬰有庸主之材，僅得中佐，山東雖亂，秦之地可全而有，宗廟之祀未當絕也。
s0686.literal: If Prince Ying had had the abilities of an ordinary lord and merely obtained moderate assistance, though Shandong was in chaos, Qin's territory could have been preserved intact, and the ancestral temple sacrifices need not have been cut off.
s0686.idiomatic: If Prince Ying had had the abilities of an ordinary lord and merely obtained moderate assistance, though Shandong was in chaos, Qin's territory could have been preserved intact, and the ancestral temple sacrifices need not have been cut off.

s0687.chinese: 秦地被山帶河以為固，四塞之國也。
s0687.literal: Qin's territory was backed by mountains and bordered by rivers as natural defenses; it was a state protected by four barriers.
s0687.idiomatic: Qin's territory was backed by mountains and bordered by rivers as natural defenses; it was a state protected by four barriers.

s0688.chinese: 自繆公以來，至於秦王，二十餘君，常為諸侯雄。
s0688.literal: From Duke Mu onward to the King of Qin, over twenty lords constantly were the most powerful among feudal lords.
s0688.idiomatic: From Duke Mu onward to the King of Qin, over twenty lords constantly were the most powerful among feudal lords.

s0690.literal: No, the strategic position was naturally thus.
s0690.idiomatic: No, the strategic position was naturally thus.

s0691.chinese: 且天下嘗同心并力而攻秦矣。
s0691.literal: Moreover, all under Heaven once united their hearts and combined their forces to attack Qin.
s0691.idiomatic: Moreover, all under Heaven once united their hearts and combined their forces to attack Qin.

s0692.chinese: 當此之世，賢智并列，良將行其師，賢相通其謀，然困於阻險而不能進，秦乃延入戰而為之開關，百萬之徒逃北而遂壞。
s0692.literal: At that time, the wise and intelligent were arrayed together, excellent generals led their armies, worthy prime ministers implemented their strategies, yet they were obstructed by dangerous terrain and could not advance; Qin then drew them into battle and opened the passes for them; millions of their troops fled northward and were thus defeated.
s0692.idiomatic: At that time, the wise and intelligent were arrayed together, excellent generals led their armies, worthy prime ministers implemented their strategies, yet they were obstructed by dangerous terrain and could not advance; Qin then drew them into battle and opened the passes for them; millions of their troops fled northward and were thus defeated.

s0693.literal: Was it that courage, strength, and wisdom were insufficient?
s0693.idiomatic: Was it that courage, strength, and wisdom were insufficient?

s0694.literal: No, the terrain was not favorable and the strategic position not advantageous.
s0694.idiomatic: No, the terrain was not favorable and the strategic position not advantageous.

s0695.chinese: 秦小邑并大城，守險塞而軍，高壘毋戰，閉關據阨，荷戟而守之。
s0695.literal: If Qin had defended small towns and garrisoned large cities, guarded strategic passes and stationed troops, raised high ramparts without engaging in battle, closed passes and occupied chokepoints, shouldering halberds to guard them—
s0695.idiomatic: If Qin had defended small towns and garrisoned large cities, guarded strategic passes and stationed troops, raised high ramparts without engaging in battle, closed passes and occupied chokepoints, shouldering halberds to guard them—

s0696.chinese: 諸侯起於匹夫，以利合，非有素王之行也。
s0696.literal: The feudal lords arose from among commoners, united by profit, without the conduct of legitimate kingship.
s0696.idiomatic: The feudal lords arose from among commoners, united by profit, without the conduct of legitimate kingship.

s0697.chinese: 其交未親，其下未附，名為亡秦，其實利之也。
s0697.literal: Their alliances were not yet close, their subordinates not yet attached; in name they sought to destroy Qin, but in reality each sought their own profit.
s0697.idiomatic: Their alliances were not yet close, their subordinates not yet attached; in name they sought to destroy Qin, but in reality each sought their own profit.

s0698.chinese: 彼見秦阻之難犯也，必退師。
s0698.literal: When they saw how difficult Qin's barriers were to attack, they would surely retreat.
s0698.idiomatic: When they saw how difficult Qin's barriers were to attack, they would surely retreat.

s0699.chinese: 安土息民，以待其敝，收弱扶罷，以令大國之君，不患不得意於海內。
s0699.literal: Settling the land and resting the people, waiting for their exhaustion, gathering the weak and supporting the weary, to order the lords of great states—they would not worry about not achieving their will within the seas.
s0699.idiomatic: Settling the land and resting the people, waiting for their exhaustion, gathering the weak and supporting the weary, to order the lords of great states—they would not worry about not achieving their will within the seas.

s0700.chinese: 貴為天子，富有天下，而身為禽者，其救敗非也。
s0700.literal: Noble as Son of Heaven, wealthy possessing all under Heaven, yet his body became a captive—this was because his method for averting defeat was wrong.
s0700.idiomatic: Noble as Son of Heaven, wealthy possessing all under Heaven, yet his body became a captive—this was because his method for averting defeat was wrong.

s0701.chinese: 秦王足己不問，遂過而不變。
s0701.literal: The Qin king was self-satisfied and did not inquire, thereby making errors and not changing.
s0701.idiomatic: The Qin king was self-satisfied and did not inquire, thereby making errors and not changing.

s0702.chinese: 二世受之，因而不改，暴虐以重禍。
s0702.literal: The Second Emperor inherited this and consequently did not reform; violent and tyrannical, he compounded the disaster.
s0702.idiomatic: The Second Emperor inherited this and consequently did not reform; violent and tyrannical, he compounded the disaster.

s0703.chinese: 子嬰孤立無親，危弱無輔。
s0703.literal: Prince Ying stood isolated without relatives, endangered and weak without support.
s0703.idiomatic: Prince Ying stood isolated without relatives, endangered and weak without support.

s0704.chinese: 三主惑而終身不悟，亡，不亦宜乎？
s0704.literal: The three lords were confused and never awakened their entire lives; that they perished, was this not appropriate?
s0704.idiomatic: The three lords were confused and never awakened their entire lives; that they perished, was this not appropriate?

s0705.chinese: 當此時也，世非無深慮知化之士也，然所以不敢盡忠拂過者，秦俗多忌諱之禁，忠言未卒於口而身為戮沒矣。
s0705.literal: At this time, the age was not without deeply thoughtful scholars who understood transformation, but the reason they dared not exhaust loyalty and brush aside faults was that Qin customs had many taboos and prohibitions; loyal words not yet finished from the mouth and the body was already executed and destroyed.
s0705.idiomatic: At this time, the age was not without deeply thoughtful scholars who understood transformation, but the reason they dared not exhaust loyalty and brush aside faults was that Qin customs had many taboos and prohibitions; loyal words not yet finished from the mouth and the body was already executed and destroyed.

s0706.chinese: 故使天下之士，傾耳而聽，重足而立，拑口而不言。
s0706.literal: Therefore all the scholars throughout the land inclined their ears to listen, stood hesitantly with feet together, and clamped their mouths shut without speaking.
s0706.idiomatic: Therefore all the scholars throughout the land inclined their ears to listen, stood hesitantly with feet together, and clamped their mouths shut without speaking.

s0707.chinese: 是以三主失道，忠臣不敢諫，智士不敢謀，天下已亂，姦不上聞，豈不哀哉！
s0707.literal: Therefore the three lords lost the Way, loyal ministers dared not remonstrate, wise scholars dared not plan; all under Heaven was already in chaos, yet treachery was not reported above; is this not sorrowful!
s0707.idiomatic: Therefore the three lords lost the Way, loyal ministers dared not remonstrate, wise scholars dared not plan; all under Heaven was already in chaos, yet treachery was not reported above; is this not sorrowful!

s0708.chinese: 先王知雍蔽之傷國也，故置公卿大夫士，以飾法設刑，而天下治。
s0708.literal: The former kings knew that obstruction and concealment harmed the state, so they established dukes, ministers, great officials, and lesser officials to adorn laws and establish punishments, and all under Heaven was governed.
s0708.idiomatic: The former kings knew that obstruction and concealment harmed the state, so they established dukes, ministers, great officials, and lesser officials to adorn laws and establish punishments, and all under Heaven was governed.

s0709.chinese: 其彊也，禁暴誅亂而天下服。
s0709.literal: When strong, they prohibited violence and punished chaos, and all under Heaven submitted.
s0709.idiomatic: When strong, they prohibited violence and punished chaos, and all under Heaven submitted.

s0710.chinese: 其弱也，五伯征而諸侯從。
s0710.literal: When it was weak, the Five Hegemons led campaigns and the feudal lords followed.
s0710.idiomatic: When it was weak, the Five Hegemons led campaigns and the feudal lords followed.

s0711.chinese: 其削也，內守外附而社稷存。
s0711.literal: When it was reduced in power, internally it guarded itself, externally others remained attached, and the altars of soil and grain were preserved.
s0711.idiomatic: When it was reduced in power, internally it guarded itself, externally others remained attached, and the altars of soil and grain were preserved.

s0712.chinese: 故秦之盛也，繁法嚴刑而天下振；
s0712.literal: Thus when Qin was at its peak with numerous laws and severe punishments, all under Heaven trembled;
s0712.idiomatic: Thus when Qin was at its peak with numerous laws and severe punishments, all under Heaven trembled;

s0713.chinese: 及其衰也，百姓怨望而海內畔矣。
s0713.literal: when it declined, the hundred clans were resentful and discontented, and all within the seas rebelled.
s0713.idiomatic: when it declined, the hundred clans were resentful and discontented, and all within the seas rebelled.

s0714.chinese: 故周五序得其道，而千餘歲不絕。
s0714.literal: Thus Zhou with its five ranks of nobility obtained the Way and lasted over a thousand years without being cut off.
s0714.idiomatic: Thus Zhou with its five ranks of nobility obtained the Way and lasted over a thousand years without being cut off.

s0715.literal: Qin failed in both beginning and end, and therefore did not last long.
s0715.idiomatic: Qin failed in both beginning and end, and therefore did not last long.

s0716.chinese: 由此觀之，安危之統相去遠矣。
s0716.literal: Viewing it from this perspective, the patterns of safety and danger are vastly different.
s0716.idiomatic: Viewing it from this perspective, the patterns of safety and danger are vastly different.

s0717.chinese: 野諺曰「前事之不忘，後事之師也」。
s0717.literal: A rustic proverb says: 'Not forgetting past affairs, they are the teacher of future affairs.'
s0717.idiomatic: A rustic proverb says: 'Not forgetting past affairs, they are the teacher of future affairs.'

s0718.chinese: 是以君子為國，觀之上古，驗之當世，參以人事，察盛衰之理，審權勢之宜，去就有序，變化有時，故曠日長久而社稷安矣。
s0718.literal: Therefore when the superior person governs a state, he observes high antiquity, verifies in the present age, considers human affairs, examines the principles of prosperity and decline, carefully considers the propriety of authority and power; going and staying have order, transformation and change have proper times; thus over long durations the altars of soil and grain are secure.
s0718.idiomatic: Therefore when the superior person governs a state, he observes high antiquity, verifies in the present age, considers human affairs, examines the principles of prosperity and decline, carefully considers the propriety of authority and power; going and staying have order, transformation and change have proper times; thus over long durations the altars of soil and grain are secure.

s0719.chinese: 秦孝公據殽函之固，擁雍州之地，君臣固守而窺周室，有席卷天下，包舉宇內，囊括四海之意，并吞八荒之心。
s0719.literal: Duke Xiao of Qin occupied the stronghold of Xiao and Han and controlled the lands of Yongzhou; lord and ministers firmly defended their position while looking covetously upon the Zhou royal house, harboring the intention to roll up all under Heaven, embrace the universe, encompass the four seas, and the ambition to swallow the eight wastes.
s0719.idiomatic: Duke Xiao of Qin occupied the stronghold of Xiao and Han and controlled the lands of Yongzhou; lord and ministers firmly defended their position while looking covetously upon the Zhou royal house, harboring the intention to roll up all under Heaven, embrace the universe, encompass the four seas, and the ambition to swallow the eight wastes.

s0720.chinese: 當是時，商君佐之，內立法度，務耕織，修守戰之備，外連衡而鬬諸侯，於是秦人拱手而取西河之外。
s0720.literal: At that time, Shang Yang assisted him: internally establishing laws and regulations, promoting agriculture and weaving, maintaining defensive and offensive preparations; externally using horizontal alliances to make the feudal lords fight each other; thereupon the Qin people effortlessly took the territory west of the Yellow River.
s0720.idiomatic: At that time, Shang Yang assisted him: internally establishing laws and regulations, promoting agriculture and weaving, maintaining defensive and offensive preparations; externally using horizontal alliances to make the feudal lords fight each other; thereupon the Qin people effortlessly took the territory west of the Yellow River.

s0721.chinese: 孝公既沒，惠王、武王蒙故業，因遺冊，南兼漢中，西舉巴、蜀，東割膏腴之地，收要害之郡。
s0721.literal: After Duke Xiao died, Kings Hui and Wu inherited the old enterprise and followed his established policies, annexing Hanzhong to the south, taking Ba and Shu to the west, cutting off fertile lands to the east, and gathering strategic commanderies.
s0721.idiomatic: After Duke Xiao died, Kings Hui and Wu inherited the old enterprise and followed his established policies, annexing Hanzhong to the south, taking Ba and Shu to the west, cutting off fertile lands to the east, and gathering strategic commanderies.

s0722.chinese: 諸侯恐懼，會盟而謀弱秦，不愛珍器重寶肥美之地，以致天下之士，合從締交，相與為一。
s0722.literal: The feudal lords were afraid and fearful; they held meetings and formed alliances to plot the weakening of Qin, not begrudging precious vessels, valuable treasures, or fertile rich lands to attract scholars from throughout the land, forming vertical alliances and bonds, mutually uniting as one.
s0722.idiomatic: The feudal lords were afraid and fearful; they held meetings and formed alliances to plot the weakening of Qin, not begrudging precious vessels, valuable treasures, or fertile rich lands to attract scholars from throughout the land, forming vertical alliances and bonds, mutually uniting as one.

s0723.chinese: 當是時，齊有孟嘗，趙有平原，楚有春申，魏有信陵。
s0723.literal: At that time, Qi had Mengchang, Zhao had Pingyuan, Chu had Chunshen, Wei had Xinling.
s0723.idiomatic: At that time, Qi had Mengchang, Zhao had Pingyuan, Chu had Chunshen, Wei had Xinling.

s0724.chinese: 此四君者，皆明知而忠信，寬厚而愛人，尊賢重士，約從離衡，并韓、魏、燕、楚、齊、趙、宋、衛、中山之眾。
s0724.literal: These four lords were all intelligent and trustworthy, generous and magnanimous, loved their people, respected the worthy, and esteemed men of ability; they formed vertical alliances while disrupting horizontal ones, uniting the masses of Han, Wei, Yan, Chu, Qi, Zhao, Song, Wei, and Zhongshan.
s0724.idiomatic: These four lords were all intelligent and trustworthy, generous and magnanimous, loved their people, respected the worthy, and esteemed men of ability; they formed vertical alliances while disrupting horizontal ones, uniting the masses of Han, Wei, Yan, Chu, Qi, Zhao, Song, Wei, and Zhongshan.

s0725.chinese: 於是六國之士有寧越、徐尚、蘇秦、杜赫之屬為之謀，齊明、周最、陳軫、昭滑、樓緩、翟景、蘇厲、樂毅之徒通其意，吳起、孫臏、帶佗、兒良、王廖、田忌、廉頗、趙奢之朋制其兵。
s0725.literal: Thereupon among the scholars of the Six States were Ning Yue, Xu Shang, Su Qin, Du He and their associates who planned for them; Qi Ming, Zhou Zui, Chen Zhen, Zhao Hua, Lou Huan, Zhai Jing, Su Li, Yue Yi and their fellows who implemented their intentions; Wu Qi, Sun Bin, Dai Tuo, Ni Liang, Wang Liao, Tian Ji, Lian Po, Zhao She and their comrades who commanded their troops.
s0725.idiomatic: Thereupon among the scholars of the Six States were Ning Yue, Xu Shang, Su Qin, Du He and their associates who planned for them; Qi Ming, Zhou Zui, Chen Zhen, Zhao Hua, Lou Huan, Zhai Jing, Su Li, Yue Yi and their fellows who implemented their intentions; Wu Qi, Sun Bin, Dai Tuo, Ni Liang, Wang Liao, Tian Ji, Lian Po, Zhao She and their comrades who commanded their troops.

s0726.chinese: 常以十倍之地，百萬之眾，叩關而攻秦。
s0726.literal: Constantly with ten times the territory and millions of masses, they knocked on the passes and attacked Qin.
s0726.idiomatic: Constantly with ten times the territory and millions of masses, they knocked on the passes and attacked Qin.

s0727.chinese: 秦人開關延敵，九國之師逡巡遁逃而不敢進。
s0727.literal: The Qin people opened their passes and drew in the enemy; the armies of the Nine States hesitated, retreated, and fled without daring to advance.
s0727.idiomatic: The Qin people opened their passes and drew in the enemy; the armies of the Nine States hesitated, retreated, and fled without daring to advance.

s0728.chinese: 秦無亡矢遺鏃之費，而天下諸侯已困矣。
s0728.literal: Qin, without the expense of a lost arrow or arrowhead, had already exhausted all the feudal lords under Heaven.
s0728.idiomatic: Qin, without the expense of a lost arrow or arrowhead, had already exhausted all the feudal lords under Heaven.

s0729.chinese: 於是從散約解，爭割地而奉秦。
s0729.literal: Thereupon the vertical alliance scattered and the agreements dissolved; they competed with each other to cede territory and pay tribute to Qin.
s0729.idiomatic: Thereupon the vertical alliance scattered and the agreements dissolved; they competed with each other to cede territory and pay tribute to Qin.

s0730.chinese: 秦有餘力而制其敝，追亡逐北，伏尸百萬，流血漂鹵。
s0730.literal: Qin had surplus strength and exploited their exhaustion, pursuing the fleeing and chasing the retreating; corpses lay by the million and flowing blood floated shields.
s0730.idiomatic: Qin had surplus strength and exploited their exhaustion, pursuing the fleeing and chasing the retreating; corpses lay by the million and flowing blood floated shields.

s0731.chinese: 因利乘便，宰割天下，分裂河山，彊國請服，弱國入朝。
s0731.literal: Taking advantage and seizing the opportunity, they carved up all under Heaven and divided its mountains and rivers; strong states requested to submit, weak states came to pay court.
s0731.idiomatic: Taking advantage and seizing the opportunity, they carved up all under Heaven and divided its mountains and rivers; strong states requested to submit, weak states came to pay court.

s0732.chinese: 延及孝文王、莊襄王，享國日淺，國家無事。
s0732.literal: Extending to King Xiaowen and King Zhuangxiang, they ruled only briefly and the state had no major affairs.
s0732.idiomatic: Extending to King Xiaowen and King Zhuangxiang, they ruled only briefly and the state had no major affairs.

s0733.chinese: 及至秦王，續六世之餘烈，振長策而御宇內，吞二周而亡諸侯，履至尊而制六合，執棰拊以鞭笞天下，威振四海。
s0733.literal: When it came to the King of Qin, he continued the remaining achievements of six generations, wielding long-term strategies to control the realm; he swallowed the Two Zhous and destroyed the feudal lords, trod upon the supreme position and mastered the six directions, grasped the whip to flog all under Heaven, and his awesome power shook the four seas.
s0733.idiomatic: When it came to the King of Qin, he continued the remaining achievements of six generations, wielding long-term strategies to control the realm; he swallowed the Two Zhous and destroyed the feudal lords, trod upon the supreme position and mastered the six directions, grasped the whip to flog all under Heaven, and his awesome power shook the four seas.

s0734.chinese: 南取百越之地，以為桂林、象郡，百越之君俛首系頸，委命下吏。
s0734.literal: He took south the lands ofhundred Yue, making them Guilin and Xiang commanderies; the lords ofhundred Yuebowed their heads and bound their necks,entrusted their livesto subordinate officials.
s0734.idiomatic: He took south the lands ofhundred Yue, making them Guilin and Xiang commanderies; the lords ofhundred Yuebowed their heads and bound their necks,entrusted their livesto subordinate officials.

s0735.chinese: 乃使蒙恬北筑長城而守藩籬，卻匈奴七百餘里，胡人不敢南下而牧馬，士不敢彎弓而報怨。
s0735.literal: He then sent Meng Tian north to build the Great Wall and guard the frontier defenses, driving back the Xiongnu over seven hundred li; the Hu people dared not venture south to pasture their horses, and their warriors dared not draw their bows to avenge their grievances.
s0735.idiomatic: He then sent Meng Tian north to build the Great Wall and guard the frontier defenses, driving back the Xiongnu over seven hundred li; the Hu people dared not venture south to pasture their horses, and their warriors dared not draw their bows to avenge their grievances.

s0736.chinese: 於是廢先王之道，焚百家之言，以愚黔首。
s0736.literal: Thereupon he abolished the former kings' Way and burned the words of the hundred schools to make the black-headed people foolish.
s0736.idiomatic: Thereupon he abolished the former kings' Way and burned the words of the hundred schools to make the black-headed people foolish.

s0737.chinese: 墮名城，殺豪俊，收天下之兵聚之咸陽，銷鋒鑄鐻，以為金人十二，以弱黔首之民。
s0737.literal: He razed famous cities, killed heroes and worthy men, collected all under Heaven's weapons and gathered them at Xianyang, melted down sharp blades and cast bells, to make twelve metal men and weaken the black-headed people.
s0737.idiomatic: He razed famous cities, killed heroes and worthy men, collected all under Heaven's weapons and gathered them at Xianyang, melted down sharp blades and cast bells, to make twelve metal men and weaken the black-headed people.

s0738.chinese: 然後斬華為城，因河為津，據億丈之城，臨不測之谿以為固。
s0738.literal: Then he cut through Mount Hua as walls, relied on the river as a ford, occupied billion-zhang high walls, and overlooked unfathomable valleys to create a defense.
s0738.idiomatic: Then he cut through Mount Hua as walls, relied on the river as a ford, occupied billion-zhang high walls, and overlooked unfathomable valleys to create a defense.

s0739.chinese: 良將勁弩守要害之處，信臣精卒陳利兵而誰何，天下以定。
s0739.literal: Excellent generals and powerful crossbows guarded strategic points; trusted officials and elite troops arrayed sharp weapons and challenged whoever came; all under Heaven was settled.
s0739.idiomatic: Excellent generals and powerful crossbows guarded strategic points; trusted officials and elite troops arrayed sharp weapons and challenged whoever came; all under Heaven was settled.

s0740.chinese: 秦王之心，自以為關中之固，金城千里，子孫帝王萬世之業也。
s0740.literal: In the Qin king's mind, he considered that Guanzhong's defenses, its golden walls of a thousand li, were a ten-thousand-generation enterprise for his descendants to rule as emperors.
s0740.idiomatic: In the Qin king's mind, he considered that Guanzhong's defenses, its golden walls of a thousand li, were a ten-thousand-generation enterprise for his descendants to rule as emperors.

s0741.chinese: 秦王既沒，餘威振於殊俗。
s0741.literal: After the Qin king died, his remaining awesome power still shook foreign lands.
s0741.idiomatic: After the Qin king died, his remaining awesome power still shook foreign lands.

s0742.chinese: 陳涉，罋牖繩樞之子，甿隸之人，而遷徙之徒，才能不及中人，非有仲尼、墨翟之賢，陶朱、猗頓之富，躡足行伍之閒，而倔起什伯之中，率罷散之卒，將數百之眾，而轉攻秦。
s0742.literal: Chen She was the son of a broken jar for a window and rope for a hinge, a person of lowly farming stock, and a vagrant; his talents did not reach those of an average person, he did not have the worthiness of Zhongni or Mo Di, nor the wealth of Tao Zhu or Yi Dun; stepping among the ranks, yet suddenly rising among squad and platoon leaders, he led weary and scattered soldiers, commanded several hundred men, and turned to attack Qin.
s0742.idiomatic: Chen She was the son of a broken jar for a window and rope for a hinge, a person of lowly farming stock, and a vagrant; his talents did not reach those of an average person, he did not have the worthiness of Zhongni or Mo Di, nor the wealth of Tao Zhu or Yi Dun; stepping among the ranks, yet suddenly rising among squad and platoon leaders, he led weary and scattered soldiers, commanded several hundred men, and turned to attack Qin.

s0743.chinese: 斬木為兵，揭竿為旗，天下雲集響應，贏糧而景從，山東豪俊遂并起而亡秦族矣。
s0743.literal: Cutting wood as weapons, raising poles as flags, all under Heaven gathered like clouds and responded, winning provisions and following like shadows; Shandong heroes and worthy men thereupon rose together and destroyed the Qin clan.
s0743.idiomatic: Cutting wood as weapons, raising poles as flags, all under Heaven gathered like clouds and responded, winning provisions and following like shadows; Shandong heroes and worthy men thereupon rose together and destroyed the Qin clan.

s0744.chinese: 且夫天下非小弱也，雍州之地，殽函之固自若也。
s0744.literal: Moreover, all under Heaven was not small or weak; Yongzhou's territory and Xiao and Han's defenses remained as before.
s0744.idiomatic: Moreover, all under Heaven was not small or weak; Yongzhou's territory and Xiao and Han's defenses remained as before.

s0745.chinese: 陳涉之位，非尊於齊、楚、燕、趙、韓、魏、宋、衛、中山之君；
s0745.literal: Chen She's position was not more honored than the lords of Qi, Chu, Yan, Zhao, Han, Wei, Song, Wei, and Zhongshan;
s0745.idiomatic: Chen She's position was not more honored than the lords of Qi, Chu, Yan, Zhao, Han, Wei, Song, Wei, and Zhongshan;

s0746.chinese: 鉏櫌棘矜，非錟於句戟長鎩也；
s0746.literal: Hoes, rakes, and thorny clubs were not sharper than hooked halberds and long dagger-axes;
s0746.idiomatic: Hoes, rakes, and thorny clubs were not sharper than hooked halberds and long dagger-axes;

s0747.chinese: 適戍之眾，非抗於九國之師；
s0747.literal: The garrison conscripts could not match the armies of the Nine States;
s0747.idiomatic: The garrison conscripts could not match the armies of the Nine States;

s0748.chinese: 深謀遠慮，行軍用兵之道，非及鄉時之士也。
s0748.literal: Deep far-reaching plans and the way of military campaigns did not equal those of the men of former times.
s0748.idiomatic: Deep far-reaching plans and the way of military campaigns did not equal those of the men of former times.

s0749.chinese: 然而成敗異變，功業相反也。
s0749.literal: Yet success and failure differed, and achievements and enterprises were contrary.
s0749.idiomatic: Yet success and failure differed, and achievements and enterprises were contrary.

s0750.chinese: 試使山東之國與陳涉度長絜大，比權量力，則不可同年而語矣。
s0750.literal: If you try to have the Shandong states and Chen She measure length and compare size, compare and weigh power, then they cannot be spoken of in the same terms.
s0750.idiomatic: If you try to have the Shandong states and Chen She measure length and compare size, compare and weigh power, then they cannot be spoken of in the same terms.

s0751.chinese: 然秦以區區之地，千乘之權，招八州而朝同列，百有餘年矣。
s0751.literal: Yet Qin with its small territory, a thousand chariots' authority, attracted the eight provinces and held court with peers for over a hundred years.
s0751.idiomatic: Yet Qin with its small territory, a thousand chariots' authority, attracted the eight provinces and held court with peers for over a hundred years.

s0752.chinese: 然後以六合為家，殽函為宮，一夫作難而七廟墮，身死人手，為天下笑者，何也？
s0752.literal: Then to make the six directions as home, Xiao and Han as palace; one man caused trouble and the seven temples collapsed, his body died at men's hands, becoming the laughingstock of all under Heaven—why?
s0752.idiomatic: Then to make the six directions as home, Xiao and Han as palace; one man caused trouble and the seven temples collapsed, his body died at men's hands, becoming the laughingstock of all under Heaven—why?

s0753.chinese: 仁義不施而攻守之勢異也。
s0753.literal: Because benevolence and righteousness were not implemented and the strategic situations of attacking and defending differ.
s0753.idiomatic: Because benevolence and righteousness were not implemented and the strategic situations of attacking and defending differ.

s0754.chinese: 秦并海內，兼諸侯，南面稱帝，以養四海，天下之士斐然鄉風，若是者何也？
s0754.literal: When Qin unified all within the seas, annexed the feudal lords, faced south and called himself emperor to rule the four seas, all under Heaven's scholars in admiration turned toward him—why was this so?
s0754.idiomatic: When Qin unified all within the seas, annexed the feudal lords, faced south and called himself emperor to rule the four seas, all under Heaven's scholars in admiration turned toward him—why was this so?

s0755.literal: It is said: In recent antiquity there had been no king for a long time.
s0755.idiomatic: It is said: In recent antiquity there had been no king for a long time.

s0756.chinese: 周室卑微，五霸既歿，令不行於天下，是以諸侯力政，彊侵弱，眾暴寡，兵革不休，士民罷敝。
s0756.literal: The Zhou royal house was lowly, the Five Hegemons had already died, and commands were not implemented throughout the land; therefore feudal lords ruled by force, the strong invaded the weak, the many oppressed the few, weapons and war did not cease, and warriors and people were exhausted.
