s0756.idiomatic: The Zhou royal house was lowly, the Five Hegemons had already died, and commands were not implemented throughout the land; therefore feudal lords ruled by force, the strong invaded the weak, the many oppressed the few, weapons and war did not cease, and warriors and people were exhausted.

s0757.chinese: 今秦南面而王天下，是上有天子也。
s0757.literal: Now Qin faced south and ruled all under Heaven; above there was a Son of Heaven.
s0757.idiomatic: Now Qin faced south and ruled all under Heaven; above there was a Son of Heaven.

s0758.chinese: 既元元之民冀得安其性命，莫不虛心而仰上，當此之時，守威定功，安危之本在於此矣。
s0758.literal: The common people hoped to secure their lives; none did not with empty hearts look up to their superior; at this time, guarding awesome power and establishing achievements, the root of safety and danger was here.
s0758.idiomatic: The common people hoped to secure their lives; none did not with empty hearts look up to their superior; at this time, guarding awesome power and establishing achievements, the root of safety and danger was here.

s0759.chinese: 秦王懷貪鄙之心，行自奮之智，不信功臣，不親士民，廢王道，立私權，禁文書而酷刑法，先詐力而後仁義，以暴虐為天下始。
s0759.literal: The Qin king harbored greedy and base intentions, practiced self-reliant cleverness, did not trust meritorious officials, was not close to officials and people, abolished the kingly way, established personal authority, prohibited writings and imposed harsh punishments and laws, prioritized deception and force while placing last benevolence and righteousness, using cruel tyranny as the foundation for all under Heaven.
s0759.idiomatic: The Qin king harbored greedy and base intentions, practiced self-reliant cleverness, did not trust meritorious officials, was not close to officials and people, abolished the kingly way, established personal authority, prohibited writings and imposed harsh punishments and laws, prioritized deception and force while placing last benevolence and righteousness, using cruel tyranny as the foundation for all under Heaven.

s0760.chinese: 夫并兼者高詐力，安定者貴順權，此言取與守不同術也。
s0760.literal: Those who unify and annex honor deception and force; those who stabilize and tranquilize value following proper authority; this means that taking and holding require different techniques.
s0760.idiomatic: Those who unify and annex honor deception and force; those who stabilize and tranquilize value following proper authority; this means that taking and holding require different techniques.

s0761.chinese: 秦離戰國而王天下，其道不易，其政不改，是其所以取之守之者［無］異也。
s0761.literal: Qin emerged from the Warring States and ruled all under Heaven; its way did not change, its government did not reform; thus the means by which it took and held were not different.
s0761.idiomatic: Qin emerged from the Warring States and ruled all under Heaven; its way did not change, its government did not reform; thus the means by which it took and held were not different.

s0762.chinese: 孤獨而有之，故其亡可立而待。
s0762.literal: Alone possessing it, therefore its destruction could be immediate.
s0762.idiomatic: Alone possessing it, therefore its destruction could be immediate.

s0763.chinese: 借使秦王計上世之事，并殷周之跡，以制御其政，後雖有淫驕之主而未有傾危之患也。
s0763.literal: If the Qin king had considered the affairs of earlier generations, combined the precedents of Yin and Zhou to regulate its government, later even if there were a licentious and arrogant ruler, there would not have been the danger of collapse.
s0763.idiomatic: If the Qin king had considered the affairs of earlier generations, combined the precedents of Yin and Zhou to regulate its government, later even if there were a licentious and arrogant ruler, there would not have been the danger of collapse.

s0764.chinese: 故三王之建天下，名號顯美，功業長久。
s0764.literal: Therefore the Three Kings in establishing all under Heaven had illustrious titles and names, and long-lasting achievements and enterprises.
s0764.idiomatic: Therefore the Three Kings in establishing all under Heaven had illustrious titles and names, and long-lasting achievements and enterprises.

s0765.chinese: 今秦二世立，天下莫不引領而觀其政。
s0765.literal: When the Qin Second Emperor was established, all under Heaven without exception craned their necks to observe his government.
s0765.idiomatic: When the Qin Second Emperor was established, all under Heaven without exception craned their necks to observe his government.

s0766.chinese: 夫寒者利裋褐而饑者甘糟糠，天下之嗷嗷，新主之資也。
s0766.literal: Those who are cold find short coarse robes beneficial, while those who are hungry find husks and dregs sweet; all under Heaven's clamoring was the new lord's resource.
s0766.idiomatic: Those who are cold find short coarse robes beneficial, while those who are hungry find husks and dregs sweet; all under Heaven's clamoring was the new lord's resource.

s0767.literal: This means that with laboring people it is easy to practice benevolence.
s0767.idiomatic: This means that with laboring people it is easy to practice benevolence.

s0768.chinese: 鄉使二世有庸主之行，而任忠賢，臣主一心而憂海內之患，縞素而正先帝之過，裂地分民以封功臣之後，建國立君以禮天下，虛囹圉而免刑戮，除去收帑汙穢之罪，使各反其鄉里，發倉廩，散財幣，以振孤獨窮困之士，輕賦少事，以佐百姓之急，約法省刑以持其後，使天下之人皆得自新，更節修行，各慎其身，塞萬民之望，而以威德與天下，天下集矣。
s0768.literal: If the Second Emperor had had the conduct of a mediocre ruler and employed loyal and worthy men, if lord and ministers had been united in purpose while worrying about troubles within the seas, worn white mourning garments to rectify the First Emperor's errors, divided territory and people to enfeoff descendants of meritorious officials, established states and installed lords to show respect to all under Heaven, emptied prisons and pardoned those sentenced to punishments, removed and canceled charges for confiscated property and corruption, made each return to their villages, opened granaries, distributed wealth to relieve the lonely, poor, and distressed, lightened taxes and reduced corvée to aid the people's urgent needs, simplified laws and reduced punishments to maintain the future, enabled all under Heaven's people to obtain self-renewal, again moderate their conduct, each be careful with themselves, fulfill the people's hopes, and with awesome virtue shared all under Heaven, all under Heaven would have gathered.
s0768.idiomatic: If the Second Emperor had had the conduct of a mediocre ruler and employed loyal and worthy men, if lord and ministers had been united in purpose while worrying about troubles within the seas, worn white mourning garments to rectify the First Emperor's errors, divided territory and people to enfeoff descendants of meritorious officials, established states and installed lords to show respect to all under Heaven, emptied prisons and pardoned those sentenced to punishments, removed and canceled charges for confiscated property and corruption, made each return to their villages, opened granaries, distributed wealth to relieve the lonely, poor, and distressed, lightened taxes and reduced corvée to aid the people's urgent needs, simplified laws and reduced punishments to maintain the future, enabled all under Heaven's people to obtain self-renewal, again moderate their conduct, each be careful with themselves, fulfill the people's hopes, and with awesome virtue shared all under Heaven, all under Heaven would have gathered.

s0769.chinese: 即四海之內，皆讙各自安樂其處，唯恐有變，雖有狡猾之民，無離上之心，則不軌之臣無以飾其智，而暴亂之姦止矣。
s0769.literal: If all within the four seas would rejoice, each content in their positions, only fearing change, even if there were cunning people without hearts departing from their superior, then treacherous ministers would have no way to display their cleverness, and violent rebellious treachery would cease.
s0769.idiomatic: If all within the four seas would rejoice, each content in their positions, only fearing change, even if there were cunning people without hearts departing from their superior, then treacherous ministers would have no way to display their cleverness, and violent rebellious treachery would cease.

s0770.chinese: 二世不行此術，而重之以無道，壞宗廟與民，更始作阿房宮，繁刑嚴誅，吏治刻深，賞罰不當，賦斂無度，天下多事，吏弗能紀，百姓困窮而主弗收恤。
s0770.literal: The Second Emperor did not follow this technique, but compounded it with lacking the Way, destroyed ancestral temples and the people, again began building Epang Palace, multiplied punishments and harsh executions, officials' administration was harsh and severe, rewards and punishments were inappropriate, taxation was without limit, all under Heaven was in much turmoil, officials could not record it all, the hundred clans were impoverished and distressed while the lord did not care for them.
s0770.idiomatic: The Second Emperor did not follow this technique, but compounded it with lacking the Way, destroyed ancestral temples and the people, again began building Epang Palace, multiplied punishments and harsh executions, officials' administration was harsh and severe, rewards and punishments were inappropriate, taxation was without limit, all under Heaven was in much turmoil, officials could not record it all, the hundred clans were impoverished and distressed while the lord did not care for them.

s0771.chinese: 然後姦偽并起，而上下相遁，蒙罪者眾，刑戮相望於道，而天下苦之。
s0771.literal: Then treachery and fraud arose together, and superiors and inferiors mutually evaded responsibility; those who suffered punishment were numerous, executions and punishments lined the roads, and all under Heaven suffered from it.
s0771.idiomatic: Then treachery and fraud arose together, and superiors and inferiors mutually evaded responsibility; those who suffered punishment were numerous, executions and punishments lined the roads, and all under Heaven suffered from it.

s0772.chinese: 自君卿以下至于眾庶，人懷自危之心，親處窮苦之實，咸不安其位，故易動也。
s0772.literal: From lord and duke downward to the common masses, people harbored fears for their own safety, personally dwelt in actual poverty and suffering, all insecure in their positions, and therefore easily moved to rebellion.
s0772.idiomatic: From lord and duke downward to the common masses, people harbored fears for their own safety, personally dwelt in actual poverty and suffering, all insecure in their positions, and therefore easily moved to rebellion.

s0773.chinese: 是以陳涉不用湯武之賢，不藉公侯之尊，奮臂於大澤而天下響應者，其民危也。
s0773.literal: Therefore Chen She did not possess the worthiness of Tang and Wu, did not rely on the honor of dukes and marquises, raised his arm at Daze and all under Heaven responded, because the people were in danger.
s0773.idiomatic: Therefore Chen She did not possess the worthiness of Tang and Wu, did not rely on the honor of dukes and marquises, raised his arm at Daze and all under Heaven responded, because the people were in danger.

s0774.chinese: 故先王見始終之變，知存亡之機，是以牧民之道，務在安之而已。
s0774.literal: Therefore the former kings saw the changes of beginning and end and understood the key to survival and destruction; therefore the way of shepherding the people is that the priority is simply in making them secure.
s0774.idiomatic: Therefore the former kings saw the changes of beginning and end and understood the key to survival and destruction; therefore the way of shepherding the people is that the priority is simply in making them secure.

s0775.chinese: 天下雖有逆行之臣，必無響應之助矣。
s0775.literal: Though all under Heaven has rebellious ministers, there will surely be no responsive assistance.
s0775.idiomatic: Though all under Heaven has rebellious ministers, there will surely be no responsive assistance.

s0776.chinese: 故曰「安民可與行義，而危民易與為非」，此之謂也。
s0776.literal: Therefore it is said 'with secure people one can practice righteousness, while with endangered people it is easy to do wrong'—this is what it means.
s0776.idiomatic: Therefore it is said 'with secure people one can practice righteousness, while with endangered people it is easy to do wrong'—this is what it means.

s0923.chinese: 三十七年，兵無所不加，制作政令，施於後王。

s0923.idiomatic: For thirty-seven years, his troops went everywhere without exception; his regulations of government orders were applied for later kings.

s0924.chinese: 蓋得聖人之威，河神授圖，據狼、狐，蹈參、伐，佐政驅除，距之稱始皇。
s0924.literal: He obtained the sage's awesome power; the Yellow River god bestowed the diagram; he occupied the Wolf and Fox stars, trod upon the Shen and Fa stars; assisted the government to drive out enemies; therefore he called himself First Emperor.
s0924.idiomatic: He obtained the sage's awesome power; the Yellow River god bestowed the diagram; he occupied the Wolf and Fox stars, trod upon the Shen and Fa stars; assisted the government to drive out enemies; therefore he called himself First Emperor.

s0925.chinese: 始皇既歿，胡亥極愚，酈山未畢，復作阿房，以遂前策。
s0925.literal: After the First Emperor died, Huhai was extremely foolish; Lishan was not yet finished, yet he resumed building Epang Palace to continue the former policy.
s0925.idiomatic: After the First Emperor died, Huhai was extremely foolish; Lishan was not yet finished, yet he resumed building Epang Palace to continue the former policy.

s0926.chinese: 云「凡所為貴有天下者，肆意極欲，大臣至欲罷先君所為」。
s0926.literal: He said 'the reason it is valuable to have all under Heaven is to indulge his will and desires to the utmost; great ministers even wanted to cease what the former lord was doing.'
s0926.idiomatic: He said 'the reason it is valuable to have all under Heaven is to indulge his will and desires to the utmost; great ministers even wanted to cease what the former lord was doing.'

s0927.literal: He executed Si and Quji and employed Zhao Gao.

s0928.literal: How painful indeed were his words!

s0929.literal: A human head with animal cries.
s0929.idiomatic: A human head with animal cries.

s0930.chinese: 不威不伐惡，不篤不虛亡，距之不得留，殘虐以促期，雖居形便之國，猶不得存。
s0930.literal: Without awesome power he did not attack evil; without firmness he did not be emptily destroyed; distancing him he could not stay; cruel and brutal to hasten the time; though occupying a naturally advantageous state, still he could not survive.
s0930.idiomatic: Without awesome power he did not attack evil; without firmness he did not be emptily destroyed; distancing him he could not stay; cruel and brutal to hasten the time; though occupying a naturally advantageous state, still he could not survive.

s0931.chinese: 子嬰度次得嗣，冠玉冠，佩華紱，車黃屋，從百司，謁七廟。
s0931.literal: Prince Ying in proper order obtained succession, wore a jade cap, wore ornate ribbons, rode a yellow-roofed carriage, attended by the hundred officials, and paid respects at the seven temples.
s0931.idiomatic: Prince Ying in proper order obtained succession, wore a jade cap, wore ornate ribbons, rode a yellow-roofed carriage, attended by the hundred officials, and paid respects at the seven temples.

s0932.chinese: 小人乘非位，莫不怳忽失守，偷安日日，獨能長念卻慮，父子作權，近取於戶牖之閒，竟誅猾臣，為君討賊。
s0932.literal: Petty men occupying improper positions, none did not in a daze lose their positions and seek ease day by day; only he could think long and worry carefully; father and son made plans, took action nearby between door and window, finally executed the treacherous minister, and for his lord punished the traitor.
s0932.idiomatic: Petty men occupying improper positions, none did not in a daze lose their positions and seek ease day by day; only he could think long and worry carefully; father and son made plans, took action nearby between door and window, finally executed the treacherous minister, and for his lord punished the traitor.

s0933.chinese: 高死之後，賓婚未得盡相勞，餐未及下咽，酒未及濡脣，楚兵已屠關中，真人翔霸上，素車嬰組，奉其符璽，以歸帝者。
s0933.literal: After Gao died, guests and relatives had not yet finished consoling each other, the meal had not yet been swallowed, wine had not yet moistened his lips; Chu troops had already slaughtered through Guanzhong; the true person hovered over Bashang; in a plain carriage with white cords, he presented the seals and tallies to the one who would be emperor.

s0934.chinese: 鄭伯茅旌鸞刀，嚴王退舍。

s0934.idiomatic: Zheng Bo with straw banner and decorative knife; the solemn king withdrew his camp.

s0935.chinese: 河決不可復壅，魚爛不可復全。
s0935.literal: When the Yellow River breaks through it cannot be dammed up again; when fish rots it cannot be made whole again.
s0935.idiomatic: When the Yellow River breaks through it cannot be dammed up again; when fish rots it cannot be made whole again.

s0936.chinese: 賈誼、司馬遷曰：「向使嬰有庸主之才，僅得中佐，山東雖亂，秦之地可全而有，宗廟之祀未當絕也。」
s0936.literal: Jia Yi and Sima Qian said: "If Ying had had the talent of a mediocre ruler, merely obtaining moderate assistance, though Shandong was in chaos, Qin's territory could have been kept intact, and the ancestral temple sacrifices should not have been cut off."
s0936.idiomatic: Jia Yi and Sima Qian said: "If Ying had had the talent of a mediocre ruler, merely obtaining moderate assistance, though Shandong was in chaos, Qin's territory could have been kept intact, and the ancestral temple sacrifices should not have been cut off."

s0937.chinese: 秦之積衰，天下土崩瓦解，雖有周旦之材，無所復陳其巧，而以責一日之孤，誤哉！
s0937.literal: Qin's accumulated decline left all under Heaven crumbled like earth and shattered like tiles; even with the talent of the Duke of Zhou, there was nowhere to deploy his skills again, yet to blame this day's orphan—mistaken indeed!
s0937.idiomatic: Qin's accumulated decline left all under Heaven crumbled like earth and shattered like tiles; even with the talent of the Duke of Zhou, there was nowhere to deploy his skills again, yet to blame this day's orphan—mistaken indeed!

s0938.chinese: 俗傳秦始皇起罪惡，胡亥極，得其理矣。
s0938.literal: Popular tradition says the Qin First Emperor initiated evil crimes and Huhai took it to the extreme; this is reasonable.
s0938.idiomatic: Popular tradition says the Qin First Emperor initiated evil crimes and Huhai took it to the extreme; this is reasonable.

s0939.chinese: 復責小子，云秦地可全，所謂不通時變者也。
s0939.literal: To again blame the youth, saying Qin's territory could be preserved intact—this is what is meant by not understanding changing times.
s0939.idiomatic: To again blame the youth, saying Qin's territory could be preserved intact—this is what is meant by not understanding changing times.
